title: dragalia_lost
body:
[[Nintendo]] and [[Cygames]]' mobile RPG game featuring people with the ability to turn into [[dragon|dragons]]. It is a successor to the cancelled [[knights_of_glory|Knights of Glory]] game with many designs, characters and lore being lifted from that game, particularly the dragons. It revolves around the seventh scion [[Euden]] and his friends of New Alberia fighting against the forces of [[Morsayati]] and the Dyrenell Empire. 

The main cast initially consists of:

* Euden - The Seventh scion of Alberia and the main protagonist. He is bonded to the wind dragon [[midgardsormr_(dragalia_lost)|Midgardsormr]]. 

* [[notte_(dragalia_lost)|Notte]] - a small fairy who is a childhood friend to both Euden and [[Zethia]].

* [[elisanne|Elisanne]] - a former Paladyn of the Illian Church.

* [[Ranzal (Dragalia Lost)|Ranzal]] - a gruff but well-meaning mercenary.

* [[cleo_(dragalia_lost)|Cleo]] - a centuries year old Sylvan girl who once served the first king of Alberia, [[alberius_(dragalia_lost)|Alberius]].

* [[luca_(dragalia_lost)|Luca]] - a Sylvan archer who comes from a village in the forest, he has a sister named [[sarisse_(dragalia_lost)|Sarisse]].

* [[mym_(dragalia_lost)|Mym]]/[[brunhilda_(dragalia_lost)|Brundilda]] - The flamewyrm dragon who takes the form of girl and join's Euden's party after falling in love with him.

Additonal main characters added later:

* [[alex_(dragalia_lost)|Alex]] - A former assassin and friend of Elissane.

* [[laxi_(dragalia_lost)|Laxi]] and [[mascula_(dragalia_lost)|Mascula]] - Twin android siblings who were made by the old Dyrenell Empire. Due to an incident, Mascula gives his core to Laxi which results in them sharing a body.

* [[leif_(dragalia_lost)|Leif]] - The former Captain of the Guard for Old Alberia who defected when it became the Dyrenell Empire.

* [[chelle_(dragalia_lost)|Chelle]] - The third scion of Old Alberia and the elder sister to Euden. She is know her beauty, intelligence and cunning.


The main campaign would end on July 2022, with service terminating November 29, 2022.

h4. External links

* GamePress: "Adventurer List":https://dragalialost.gamepress.gg/adventurer-list

title: tomboy
body:
A girl who displays boyish behaviors. Girls who are tomboys tend to be very athletic and sporty.

They almost always dress like boys and frequently have short and/or spiky hair and can often be seen wearing tight cycling shorts. Examples include [[Kagura (azumanga daioh)|]], [[Arisawa Tatsuki]] and [[Makoto (street fighter)|]]. 

Not to be confused with [[reverse trap]], which refers to a girl with an [[androgynous]] or masculine [i]physical appearance[/i] regardless of personality. An androgynous girl may not necessarily act like a tomboy and a tomboy isn't required to look androgynous. Though there is a recognizable overlap between the two. [[Crossdressing (ftm)|]] does not automatically make a girl a "tomboy" either.

[b]Note[/b]: Just having [[short hair]] is not enough to count as a tomboy. The girl in question has to act in a masculine manner.

h4. See also

* [[girly boy]] (male counterpart)

title: corn
body:
Also known as [b]maize[/b]. A cereal that consists of a cob with countless sweet kernels growing on it. Eating it straight off the cob is 'corn on the cob'.

In UK English "corn" refers to the main cereal crop of an area.  "Corn on the cob" though is universally understood to refer specifically to maize.

title: all-devouring_narwhal_(genshin_impact)
body:
A boss from [[Genshin Impact]].

The All-Devouring Narwhal is a mysterious creature not from Teyvat and is [[Surtalogi (genshin impact)|]]'s pet. At some point in time, it came to Teyvat and started consuming energy from the Primordial Sea, causing Fontaine's sea levels to rise. During [[Furina (genshin impact)|]]'s trial, the whale broke into the Opera Eclipse, but was fended off by [[Tartaglia (foul legacy transformation) (Genshin Impact)|Foul Legacy Childe]]. It is later defeated by the Traveler and [[Neuvillette (genshin impact)|]], which causes the prophesied flooding of Fontaine.

[[Skirk (genshin impact)|]] states that when the Traveler and Neuvillette fought and defeated it, the whale was in already in a satiated state, making it much weaker. It is capable of consuming entire planets when ravenous.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9635866

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

title: forest_of_magic
body:
The large [[forest]] of [[Gensokyo]] in [[Touhou]] where [[Kirisame Marisa]], [[Alice Margatroid]], and [[Yatadera Narumi]] live. The most prominent landmarks here are their houses. [[Hakurei Shrine]] and [[Kourindou]] are believed to be located just outside the forest.

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: kirisame_magic_shop
body:
[[Kirisame Marisa]]'s home, which doubles as her storefront for arcane knickknacks and alchemical tonics. Situated on the outer edge of the [[Forest of Magic]], it sees almost zero customers. The only known visitors are [[Alice Margatroid]], [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Yatadera Narumi]], and occasionally [[Morichika Rinnosuke]] and [[Yakumo Yukari]].

Notable for being a "treasure trash heap" containing literal piles of magical items, artifacts, and experiments due to Marisa's compulsive tendency to "borrow" (read: steal) things that strike her fancy, as well as her abysmal housekeeping skills.

title: uiharu_kazari
body:
Character from the anime/manga series [[ToAru Kagaku No Railgun]]. She is a friend of [[Shirai Kuroko]] and a classmate of [[Saten Ruiko]] at [[Sakugawa school uniform|Sakugawa Middle School]].

Kazari's ability as an esper is limited to keeping lunches warm by using her Level 1 Thermal Hand to keep things at constant temperature. However, she is infamous as a fearsome hacker, nicknamed "Goalkeeper", and is invaluable as an asset of [[Judgement armband (toaru)|Judgment]] and Kuroko's primary operator.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She usually wears a [[flower hairband]].

title: surtalogi_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known as "The Foul", he is one of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah and the master of [[Skirk (genshin impact)|]]. He owns the [[All-Devouring Narwhal (genshin impact)|]], which he considers a pet.

Surtalogi was a knight from Khaenri'ah who trained under Haden to learn Black Serpent Bladework. Haden was very cruel and would give unjust punsihments, once mutilating him for following the ideals of knighthood, which resulted in the loss of various limbs. He was best friends with [[Dainsleif (genshin impact)|]], but their friendship ended after Surtalogi became one of the Five Sinners.

After gaining the power of the Abyss he decided to travel the universe in search of an opponent who can best him. Eventually, he encountered [[Skirk (genshin impact)|]] and took her in as a disciple, teaching her Black Serpent Bladework and how to wield the power of the Abyss. He later sent Skirk away to train on her own, hoping that one day she will surpass him.

Surtalogi is able to take on any form he desires, though he usually takes the form of a humanoid wearing abyssal [[armor]] and wielding a [[greatsword]].

Voiced by [[Takeuchi Ryouta]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #27848483

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Surtalogi":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Surtalogi

title: g2_nile
body:
A NPC in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G2 (Pronounced 'Gun 2') Nile, referred to the river Nile in northeastern Africa. He pilots the AC 'Deep Down'.

As an [[Armored Core]] character, there is no canon depiction of Nile in game, artists depictions may draw inspirations from the region around the river Nile and/or from the AC he pilots.

Voiced by: Komatsu Fuminori (JP)

title: hellsing
body:
A 1997-2009 seinen manga written and illustrated by [[Hirano Kouta]], originally serialized in [i]Young King OURs[/i] for 89 chapters, which were collected in ten volumes. It was adapted into a 13-episode television anime (2001-2002) and a 10-episode OVA series (2006-2012), as well as a spin-off called [[Hellsing: The Dawn]].

Set in the [[United Kingdom]] during modern era. The story is centered around the Royal Order of Protestant Knights, also known by the series' titular name as "Hellsing Organization", which is responsible for eliminating supernatural threats that would threaten the country. Particularly [[vampire]]s. The Hellsings is led by [[Integra Hellsing]], the descendant of vampire hunter Abraham von Helsing, as well as her right hand man and the most capable vampire hunter, [[Alucard (Hellsing)|]] - himself the [[dracula|original and the very first vampire]] who swore loyalty to the Hellsing family after his defeat to Abraham Helsing.

h4. Characters

h5. Main characters

* [[Alucard (Hellsing)|]]

h5. Iscariot

title: help:users
body:
This page serves to describe the differences between the various user levels on Danbooru.


h4. Browsing Differences

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Feature[/th]
[th]No Account[/th]
[th]Member[/th]
[th]Gold[/th]
[th]Platinum[/th]
[th]Builder[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]View [[help:censored tags|censored tags]][/td]
[td]x[/td]
[td]x[/td]
[td]✓[/td]
[td]✓[/td]
[td]✓[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Max tags per search[/td]
[td]2[/td]
[td]2[/td]
[td]6[/td]
[td]No Limit[/td]
[td]No Limit[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Max pages per search[/td]
[td]1000[/td]
[td]1000[/td]
[td]5000[/td]
[td]5000[/td]
[td]5000[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Max search timeout[/td]
[td]3s[/td]
[td]3s[/td]
[td]6s[/td]
[td]9s[/td]
[td]9s[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Max [[help:saved_searches|saved searches]][/td]
[td]-[/td]
[td]250[/td]
[td]1,000[/td]
[td]1,000[/td]
[td]No Limit[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Max [[help:favorite_groups|favgroups]][/td]
[td]-[/td]
[td]10[/td]
[td]No Limit[/td]
[td]No Limit[/td]
[td]No Limit[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][[help:api|API regen rate]][/td]
[td]-[/td]
[td]1/s[/td]
[td]4/s[/td]
[td]4/s[/td]
[td]4/s[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4. Permissions

h6. Restricted users

* Can't edit anything until they verify their email address. A user is restricted if they signup using a VPN or proxy.

h6. Banned users

* Can't edit anything until their bans are expired.

h6. Members and above can:

* Upload posts (subject to their [[about:upload limits|upload limit]]).
* Favorite and vote on posts.
* Edit posts and tags.
* Flag posts (up to 5 per 3 days).
* Appeal posts (each appeal costs 3 upload slots).
* Create and edit pools.
* Create, edit, and delete wiki pages and artist entries.
* Create, edit, and delete their own comments and forum posts.
* Change the category of tags with less than 50 posts.
* Create, reject, and edit their own [[help:bulk_update_requests|Bulk Update Requests]].
* Send and receive DMails.
* Edit their user settings.
* Change their username (at most once a week).
* View username change history.

h6. Gold and above can:

* Create [[help:user records|feedbacks]] to other users
* Use the "mode menu":[/wiki_pages/help:posts#dtext-mode-menu] in the sidebar for quicker tagging and favoriting.
* Have private favorites, favgroups, and upvotes.
* View the forum activity indicator. The "Forum" link in the navbar will become italicized when there are unread posts.

h6. Builders and above can:

* Lock and unlock wiki pages.
* Delete and undelete pools.
* Change the category of any tag with less than 1000 posts.
* Approve alias and rename [[help:bulk update requests|bulk update requests]] for artist tags under 200 posts.

h6. Contributors and above can:

* Upload an unlimited amount of posts without being subject to the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] (their posts are automatically approved). Posts can still voluntarily be sent through the modqueue.

h6. Approvers and above can:

* Approve and undelete posts (excluding their own uploads and posts they previously approved).
* Delete posts.
* Move favorites from deleted posts to their parent post.
* Ban and unban posts.
* Flag posts without limit.

h6. Moderators and above can:

* Promote or demote users (up to Approver level).
* View the IP and session history of other users.
* Ban users, IP addresses, and IP ranges.
* Change the name of other users (Builder and below).
* Edit or delete user feedbacks (except ones given to them).
* View who voted on comments.
* View or search who flagged a post (except on their own uploads).
* Replace the image on a post with a different file.
* Edit, delete, or sticky (prevent hiding due to downvotes) comments.
* Edit or delete forum posts.
* Delete, pin, or lock/unlock forum threads.

h6. Admins can:

* Promote or demote users (up to Moderator level).
* Approve, edit, or reject bulk update requests.
* Expunge (permanently delete from the site) posts.
* Change the category of any tag.
* View who voted on posts.
* Ban or unban artist tags.
* Approve any post any number of times.
* Create site news banners.

h4#getting-promoted. Getting promoted

* [b]Member[/b] - Anyone can "sign up":/users/new for a free member account.
* [b]Gold[/b] - [s]"Buy an account upgrade for $20":[/user_upgrades/new] (one-time fee)[/s] | Currently unavailable. See topic #21157.
* [b]Platinum[/b] - [s]"Buy an account upgrade for $40":[/user_upgrades/new][/s] | Win a Platinum upgrade raffle. Raffles occur every few months on the forums.

To advance to a higher user level, you must be promoted by a Moderator or Admin. The following are general guidelines on how to get promoted:

* [b]Builder[/b] - Make a large number of improvements to the site, such as by uploading, translating, tagging, contributing to forum discussions or anything else that is helpful to other users.
* [b]Contributor[/b] - Contribute a large number of high-quality uploads. It is important to have few deleted uploads (the usual case is under 5% of the total uploads submitted in the last few months).
* [b]Approver[/b] - Have an excellent record of high quality uploads, with very few deleted. Approver promotions typically happen a few times a year, depending on the overall size of the [[about:mod_queue|modqueue]] and the number of currently active approvers, and only a handful of users are picked each time.

body: UN Uniform, officially [b]UN Force C-Type Military Uniform[/b] is a type of [[military uniform]] from the [[Muv-Luv]] series. This formal uniform usually worn by [[United Nations]] officers, UN [[Tactical Surface Fighter]] pilots when not in sortie, or attachés assigned to certain UN units.

title: beta_(tower_of_god)
body:
Beta (베타, Beta) is one of Sophia Amae's "children" and [[Kang Horyang]] 's and [[Beniamino Cassano]]'s "brother", a living Ignition Weapon created by the Workshop.

Beta is a short boy with [[pale skin]] and [[blonde hair]]. His eyes are yellow but at times his left eye goes pitch black with a red iris; in some instances, bright blue veins can be seen through his eyes. He wore a [[blue hoodie]] while he was in the care of the Workshop, but appears to prefer dark clothes after his escape. After escaping his captors, he then wore a red [[baseball cap]] with a crude face drawn on it as well as a sharp [[blue suit]]. In his current appearances, he wears a black [[t-shirt]] and [[brown shorts]] with a brown-striped black [[baseball cap]].

title: androssi_zahard
body:
Androssi Zahard (엔도르시 자하드, "Endoreusi Jahad") is a Regular and one of [[Zahard]]'s Princesses, currently climbing the Tower. Regarded as very strong and haughty, Androssi is one of [[Khun Aguero Agnis]]'s friends ever since meeting [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]].

Androssi is a fairly human-looking girl. She is said to be very pretty, as she is one of Zahard's Princesses, and has short [[brown hair]]. Her only non-human features are the small [[single horn]] on the right side of her head and her [[yellow eyes]], and colored eyelashes. She wears a [[yellow dress]] with two red pins on it and often wears [[high heels]], which sometimes gets her in trouble during combat. Androssi is currently one of the most popular Zahard's Princesses and she is said to be "milky white" by [[Ja Wangnan]] and Edin Dan.

title: dullahan
body:
A character with a removable head.

In Irish folklore, the Dullahan is a [[headless]] rider or a beheaded knight who carries his [[severed head]] under one arm while viciously attacking interlopers in the place that is haunted by the dullahan. They also have some magic in their bodies, giving them magical swords or the ability to breathe fire from the severed head.

In anime and videogames, the Dullahan is sometimes portrayed as an animated suit of [[armor]]. Examples include [[Dullahan (golden sun)|]] from [[Golden Sun]], an optional final boss character, or the [[Durahan]] species of monster in [[Monster Farm]].

h4. Notable Dullahans

* [[Celty Sturluson]] from [i][[Durarara!!]][/i]

title: luigi_(balloon_world)
body:
The outfit [[Luigi]] wears when hosting the online Balloon World minigame in [[Super Mario Odyssey]]. In this mode Luigi floats slightly thanks to a trio of helium balloons and carries a flight case on his back, using it to dispense the balloons that players hide or seek. This outfit consists of:

* Standard green cap with a white “L” emblem.
* Green long-sleeved shirt.
* Indigo denim overalls secured by oversized golden buttons.
* Shiny lime-green satin bow tie.
* White gloves and dark-brown work shoes.
* Aluminum flight case strapped to his shoulders.
* Three glossy balloons—one red, one yellow, one blue—tethered to the case.
(The balloons increase in number/colour variety in-game as the player ranks up, but most official art shows this primary-colour trio. At level one, Luigi only has the single red balloon.)

title: james_franco_first_time?_(meme)
body:
A meme that originated from the 2018 American Western Anthology film, [b]The Ballad of Buster Scruggs and Other Tales of the American Frontier[/b].

The scene comes at the end of the 2nd chapter of movie, [i]Near Algodones[/i], where a nameless cowboy, played by James Franco, is about to be executed by hanging with other criminals, where James character quips to a crying criminal, "First Time?" since he was almost hanged but escaped at the beginning of his story before being captured again. Despite the cowboy's optimism, [spoiler]he still dies by hanging by the end of the chapter.[/spoiler]

title: sei_juushi_bismarck
body:
[b]Sei Juushi Bismarck[/b], also known as [b]Star Musketeer Bismarck[/b] or simply [b]Bismark[/b], is an 80s Japanese [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] TV anime created by Studio Pierrot.

The series aired on [[nippon tv|Nippon Television]] from October 7, 1984 to September 25, 1985, totaling 51 episodes. 

In 1986, the rights to Bismark were sold to the United States company World Events Productions (WEP). WEP reorganized and rewrote the series, incorporating both original episodes and creating six new ones before releasing it in 1987 under the name [b]Saber Rider and the Star Sheriffs[/b].

h4. See also

title: enrico_maxwell
body:
Archiepiscopus Enrico Maxwell《エンリコ・マクスウェル大司教, Enriko Makusuweru Daishikyō》 is a major antagonist in the [[Hellsing]] series created by Kohta Hirano. He is voiced by Show Hayami in the Japanese sub and JB Blanc in the English dub. Risa Hayamizu and Yuri Lowenthal in Japanese and English respectively provided their voice for his younger iteration appearing in flashbacks.

He is the fanatical leader of the Iscariot Agency who seeks to exterminate all "unholy" creatures and heretics on behalf of the Roman Catholic Church. Often appearing soft-spoken and a good-natured young man, once he becomes enraged, he reveals his fanaticism, professing to regard all non-Catholics as infidels. He's one of the primary rivals of the Hellsing Organisation; thus, despite being allied to Hellsing and England, Maxwell often breaks border jurisdiction treaties and finds himself and his Agency at odds with Hellsing.

https://hellsing.fandom.com/wiki/Enrico_Maxwell
other_names: エンリコ・マクスウェル

title: jibanyan
body:
A major [[youkai (youkai watch)|youkai]] in [[Youkai Watch]]. His name is a combination of [i]jibakurei[/i] (地縛霊) "ghost bound to a particular location" and [i]nyan[/i] "meow".

He is the ghost of a red [[cat]], with a [[notched ear]] and [[two tails]], and wears a [[haramaki]]. ([[akamaru (youkai watch)|His living form]] has one tail and intact ears.)

Loves [[chocoboo]] (a [[candy bar]]) and [[NyaaKB]] (a parody of [[AKB48]]).

title: takaramonozu
body:
[i](Lit. "Treasures")[/i]

A single performed by μ's from [[Love Live!]]. It first appeared as a special song for [[Love Live! School Idol Festival]] during its year since launch.

The costume set for this song are [[cheerleader]] outfits. Each girl's color schemes are based on their image colors. Along with [[ pom pom (cheerleading)|cheerleading pom poms]], their primary appearance consist of short [[tank top]]s or [[strapless shirt]]s with [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]]s while exposing their [[midriff]]. Their legwears are at [[thighhighs|thigh length]] and wear [[inline skates|inline]] [[roller skates]] as their footwear.

The outfits have been previously exclusive to μ's, but ever since Aqours' and [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]] were introduced into the game, the latter girls have received their own versions of the outfits as well.

Aqours' cheer uniforms reappeared in [[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]] as "Happiness Cheerleader."

title: arcadea
body:
[b]Arcadea[/b] is a freeware puzzle-oriented horror game by [[aishin]], made in RPG Maker VX Ace.

h4. Story

In the world of Arcadea, people can accomplish their dreams. How? Through video games of course! Everybody who lives in Arcadea has a special arcade machine they can visit in their dreams that lets them fulfill their strongest wishes. Whether it’s to go on an adventure, or make friends, or fall in love, or solve a mystery, or completely start a new life, there’s a game made just for them...By playing these arcade machines, you can find out a lot about a person…their aspirations and their goals for example. Oh and also their regrets, their insecurities, and their biggest mistakes. Huh...video games can’t be that deep right? Must be a bug or something....Speaking of which, how do you even get to this world in the first place? 

The game follows Maisie, a new arrival to Arcadea. She’s not very interested in all this gaming stuff; her only goal is to find an important person. But along the way, she can’t help but be roped into other people’s problems. She also can’t help that the arcade machines seem to glitch around her. Alot. 
h4. Characters

* [[maisie (arcadea)|Maisie]]

title: arizona_(drink)
body:
A popular brand of [[iced tea]], [[juice]] and [[energy drink]] beverages made by the Arizona Beverages USA (stylized as [b]AriZona[/b]). Despite the name, the company is actually located in Woodbury, New York.

The brand is famous for their 22 US fl oz (650 mL) "Big Cans" drinks which cost 99 cents per can in the US.

title: q.e.d.
body:
Q.E.D. 証明終了 (Q.E.D. Shomei Shuuryou) is a detective manga by Motohiro Katou. The main character Sou Touma encounters a variety of mystery cases. Sou often works in tandem with his friend and potential love interest Kana, with him supplying the brain while she acts as brawn.

In 2009, the manga won the Kodansha Manga Award for the shōnen category, sold over a total of 3 millions copies and adapted as a live-action TV series.

title: komiya_arisa
body: A [[voice actor|voice actress]], actress and gravure idol who is most well-known for portraying [[Kurosawa Dia]] in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]] and [[Usami Youko]] in [[Tokumei Sentai Go-Busters]]. She is popularly nicknamed "Arisha".

title: kobayashi_aika
body: A [[voice actor|voice actress]] who is most well-known for her portrayal of [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. She debuted as the performer of the [[Freezing (series)|]] ending theme, [i]Kimi wa Mamoritai[/i], and as a result had her first radio interview by two [i]Freezing[/i] VAs – Kitta Izumi and future [i]Love Live![/i] colleague [[Uchida Aya]] ([[Minami Kotori|Kotori]]) (incidentally, both share the same image color: gray). She is popularly nicknamed "Aikyan".

title: gema
body:
A floating yellow ball with an upside-down face in [[Di Gi Charat]]. Ends all of his sentences with "-gema."

Gema became associated with [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]'s [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] when Yoshiko won an election to become the image girl of the Numazu Gamers store, and a resulting picture in Dengeki G's magazine depicted Gema as one of her "little demons" (post #2786245).

title: dodo_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [[Kemono Friends]] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Dodo ([i]Raphus cucullatus[/i]) was a species of flightless birds that lived in the island of Mauritius. First sighted by Dutch sailors in 1598, it went extinct by 1662 from being hunted by sailors and invasive species. Being extinct, [[empty_eyes|she lacks the shine in her eyes]].

She is usually portrayed as a complete pacifist to the point of lacking any sense of self-preservation, preaching "Love and Peace".
other_names: ドードー(けものフレンズ)

title: noppo_bread
body:
A long roll with various fillings including chocolate, sea salt and caramel and peanut butter that is a local specialty of Numazu.

This delicacy has gained popularity since it was featured in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]] – which is set in the city and the surrounding areas – as a favorite of [[Kunikida Hanamaru]]. Local manufacturers, as a result, have been producing Aqours-branded noppo bread.

title: kirby:_right_back_at_ya!
body:
A 2001-2003 anime based on the [[Kirby (series)|]] series by Studio Sign and Studio Comet (and dubbed by 4Kids). The series takes primary inspiration from [[Kirby's Adventure]], but mixes in elements from other games up to [[Kirby Air Ride]]. It was aired as [i]Hoshi no Kirby[/i] in Japan.

Several elements from the anime would be incorporated into later games, such as the design of Meta Knight's sword [[Galaxia (sword)|]], and the hats for several [[copy_ability|copy abilities]] (such as Clean) in future games such as [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]] and [[Kirby Star Allies]].

h4. Returning characters
Parenthetical names are names used by the English dub.

h5. Major
* [[Kirby]]: The main character, an alien child who can copy what he eats. His made his first major appearance in [[Kirby's Dream Land]].
* [[King Dedede]]: A selfish king with a hammer. Debuted in [[Kirby's Dream Land]].

h5. Secondary
* [[Blade Knight]]: Debuted in [[Kirby's Adventure]].
* [[Chef Kawasaki]]: Debuted in [[Kirby Super Star]]. He is known as Cook Kawasaki in Japanese.
* [[Coo (Kirby)|]]: Debuted in [[Kirby's Dream Land 2]].

h4. Anime-original characters

h5. Major
* [[Fumu (Kirby)|]] (Tiff): One of Kirby's closest friends, and [[Bun (Kirby)|]]'s big sister.
* [[Bun (Kirby)|]] (Tuff): One of Kirby's closest friends, and [[Fumu (Kirby)|]]'s little brother.
* [[Escargon]] (Escargoon): King Dedede's snail henchman. He makes a cameo appearance in [[Kirby Mass Attack]].
* [[Customer Service (Kirby)|]]: A man who sells [[monster]]s to [[King Dedede]]. He makes a cameo appearance in [[Kirby Mass Attack]].

h5. Secondary
* [[Hohhe]] (Iro): One of the town's children. Often seen alongside [[Honey (Kirby)|]] and [[Iro (Kirby)|]].
* [[Honey (Kirby)|]]: One of the town's children. Often seen alongside [[Hohhe]] and [[Iro (Kirby)|]].
* [[Iro (Kirby)|]] (Spikehead): One of the town's children. Often seen alongside [[Hohhe]] and [[Honey (Kirby)|]].
* [[Meemu (Kirby)|]] (Lady Like): Wife of [[Paamu (Kirby)|]], and mother of [[Fumu (Kirby)|]] and [[Bun (Kirby)|]].
* [[Paamu (Kirby)|]] (Sir Ebrum): Husband of [[Meemu (Kirby)|]], and father of [[Fumu (Kirby)|]] and [[Bun (Kirby)|]].
* [[Tokkori (Kirby)|]]: A yellow [[bird]] who lives with [[Kirby]].

title: emotion_(love_live!)
body:
A single by [[Mifune Shioriko]] from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Composed and made specifically for the series' second season anime.

Outfit is mainly colored green; consisting of a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[green dress]] with green waist ribbon, [[white gloves]], [[white headwear]] with green [[hat ribbon]], and [[white shoes|white]] bared [[pumps]]. Her backdrop theme often consists of a clockwork style setting.

title: usb_symbol
body: It started quite simply as a three-pronged pathway or “Trident Logo” as it is referred to by the USB-IF. This trident leads from a circle to three recognizable shapes: another (smaller) circle, an arrow-like triangle, and a square. From a design perspective, this symbol indicates that a basic USB connection port has the ability to connect to various cables and devices.

title: opera_glasses
body: A set of fancy, miniature [[binoculars]] on a stick. Used as a visual aid for opera or other performance events, or just as a fashion accessory.

title: ehime_nao
body:
Character in [[PriPara]].

Has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hairband]].

On-stage, she wears a [[blue dress]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], and puts her hair into [[twintails]].

She is voiced by [[Nanjou Yoshino]], who also voices PriPara characters [[Shirai Nanami]] and [[Tokuda Nene]]. Nanjou also voices idol [[Ayase Eli]] in [[Love Live!]].

title: elf
body:
A fantastical humanoid race characterized by their lithe frame, great finesse, youthful appearance despite long lifespans, and [[pointy ears]]. Codified by [[tolkien's_legendarium|Tolkienian literature]].

In anime-styled works, elves' characteristic were further stylized into simply a "human with pointy ears", with them almost always have [[blonde hair]]. As a result, they are often indistinguishable from half-elves. Many works (particularly NSFW) also exploit elves' longetivity by either depicting them as being more endowed than ordinary human or as a "[[loli]] baba" (mature adult in child-like body) stereotypes.

h4. Notable elf characters

* [[Alleyne (Queen's Blade)|]] and [[Echidna (Queen's Blade)|]] from [[Queen's Blade]]
* [[Alpha (Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute!)|]], [[Beta (Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute!)|]] and [[Gamma (Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute!)|]] from [[Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute!]]

title: m14
body:
The [b]M14[/b] is an [[united_states|American]]-designed 7.62×51mm NATO [b][[battle rifle]][/b], developed in 1954 by Earle Harvey and Lloyd Corbett at Springfield Armory, adopted by the U.S. military in 1959. Its design was heavily based on the earlier [[M1 Garand]], but with the 20-round detachable magazines and ability to fire in full-automatic akin to the [[M1918 BAR]] instead of an 8-round internal magazine like the Garand.

Beginning in 1963, however, the M14 began to be supplanted by the [[M16]] [[rifle]], which fully replaced the M14 as the U.S military's main firearm by 1969. The M14 continues to be used in some secondary (marksman) and specialist roles due to its firepower, longer range and accuracy.

h4. See also
* [[M14 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[Mk 14 EBR]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Ruger Mini-14]]

h4. External links

title: nase_hidehito
body:
Supporting chracter from [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]]. He is [[Bamboo Memory (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] in the continuity of Cinderella Gray.

Given that he is [[nase fumino|Fumino]]'s father, and his nick name being "The wizard of the turf", it is most likely that he is based off of Take Kunihiko, the father of [[Take Yutaka]], who Fumino's character is likely based off of.

title: broye_(umamusume)
body:
Anime-only [[Umamusume]] character. A French horse girl who is a stand-in for [[Montjeu (racehorse)|]] (who is Irish-bred but primarily raced in France). Her design is basically [[oscar_francois_de_jarjayes|Oscar François de Jarjayes]] as a [[Horse Girl]].

Montjeu would eventually get a [[Montjeu (umamusume)|real appearence]] in the game's story mode for the Japan Cup race in Special Week's story.

title: hosoe_junko
body:
Former female [[jockey]]. She was the first female jockey of the [[Japan Racing Association|JRA]], graduating the JRA Horse Racing School alongside [[Fukunaga Yuuichi]] and [[Wada Ryuji]]. Unfortunately she was forced in to an early retirement in 2001 due to her injuries, eventually becoming a racehorse writer and pundit for several racehorse related publications and TV shows.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], she has appeared as the commentator for races in both the anime and the game, as well as a bartender in [[Umayuru]] (a reference to her alter ego on YouTube/[[real life]] stint).

h4. External Links

* "Japanese Wikipedia article":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B4%B0%E6%B1%9F%E7%B4%94%E5%AD%90]

* "Snack Zunko Twitter page":[https://twitter.com/snack_zunko]

title: narita_burarian_(horse)
body:
Real-Life Japanese [[Pony (animal)|]]. This gray pony is named as a pastiche of (then recently crowned) Triple Crown Winner [[Narita Brian (racehorse)|]].

In the context of [[Umamusume]], he is typically rendered as a child-sized [[Narita Brian (umamusume)|]] [[look-alike]] with [[white hair]].

body:

An NPC runner character in the Longchamps races in [[Umamusume]], this character is notable for [[look-alike|her uncanny resemblance]] to [[Mejiro McQueen (umamusume)|]], having [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] parted on the left side and [[purple eyes]]. She has an accessory on [b]her right ear[/b] and wears a mask.

title: smart_falcon_(just_in_time!?_uma<3dol)_(umamusume)
body:
An alternate version of [[Smart Falcon (umamusume)|]] seen on her SR Guts card in the [[Umamusume]] game.

She is wearing a pink [[camisole]] and black [[yoga pants]] along with the typical hair ribbons. The "card artwork":/posts/5237899 has her doing the [[pigeon pose]] and struggling to keep herself in place.

title: toujou_hana
body:
Character in the anime version of [[Umamusume|Umamusume]].

She is the coach of Team Rigil.

She wears [[glasses]].

As the [[Tracen Academy]]'s strongest team's [[Trainer (Umamusume)|Trainer]], Hana is a mature and cool woman. When it comes to training, she is undoubtedly strict and stoic, she trains her members well and makes sure none of them are left feeble. Despite her stern nature, she sometimes bares a motherly side to her pupils.

title: trainer_minamizaka
body:
[i]Team Canopus[/i]' [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]] from Season 2 of the [[Umamusume|Umamusume]] anime.

Appears as a young man dressed smartly in a suit with [[short hair|short]], neatly-groomed [[brown hair|brown]] hair. Only his surname is given, as "Minamizaka". Generally portrayed as being closest to [[Twin Turbo (Umamusume)|]], especially in fanart.

Voiced by [[Furukawa Makoto]]. Shares some resemblance with his seiyuu, especially when the latter is also wearing a suit.

title: top_gun
body:
An American naval air force franchise about the US Navy's Strike Fighter Tactics Instructor program for select naval aviators and flight officers, which TOPGUN is the popular name for. Typically refers to the original 1986 film starring [[Tom Cruise]] as [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell]], Val Kilmer, Kelly McGillis, Anthony Edwards and Meg Ryan in her film debut. A sequel, [i][[Top Gun: Maverick]][/i], was released in 2022. 

Also the name inspiration for the race horse [[Mayano Top Gun (Racehorse)|]], who is also [[Mayano Top Gun (Umamusume)|personified]] in [[Umamusume]]. The same character was also involved in an official collaboration with the [[top gun: maverick|sequel]] (post #5348482) as a special advertising pilot.

h4.External Links:

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top_Gun
* "IMDb":http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0092099/

title: furlong02
body:
The robotic mascot of the Cosmo Puella in the [[UMA STARS (umamusume)|]] fictional anime show for [[Umamusume]]'s April Fools' 2024.

Resembles an oversized brain with rudimentary eyes in a robot suit. It being voiced by [[Sasaki Hitomi]] ([[Admire Vega (umamusume)|]]'s voice actress) implies that it might be a manifestation of [[Admire Vega's Twin Sister (umamusume)|]].

title: mecha_umamusume_st-2_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. She is nicknamed "Saty".

The titular [[robot girl|Mecha]] [[horse girl|Umamusume]] from the [i]Run, Mecha Umamusume![/i] scenario, she is built to her creator's image, resembling [[Sugar Lights (umamusume)|]] as a robot.

She is the subject of the scenario, where you gather data to improve her as you train and race your selected character.

title: shin_emperor_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]As in 'New' Emperor.[/tn]

French-bred Japanese racehorse. Sired by Siyouni and foaled by Starlet's Sister, he is a full brother to Sottsass, a winner of the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.

He is notable for being owned by Fujita Susumu, President and CEO of CyberAgent, the parent company of Cygames, who are the creators and developers of [[Umamusume]]. Shin Emperor is effectively Mr. Fujita's gamble for the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.

title: stay_gold_clan_(umamusume)
body:
A group of [[horse girl]]s in [[Umamusume]] based in real life consisting of [[Stay Gold (umamusume)|]] and her RL progeny. Due to Stay Gold's latecoming, she can be replaced by [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]] or an OC.

The tag should be used only if at least all [b]Progenies[/b] that were accessible at the time of the making of the picture are the focus of it. Again, Stay Gold herself is a late arrival and the picture might focus specifically on her progeny, so she's optional. Progenies of progenies are also optional (and currently limited to [[Lucky Lilac (umamusume)|a single character]]).

Notoriously known by the Japanese horse racing fanbase for their "quirky personalities" as their IRL counterparts are... Strange at best.

title: nyaaaanvy
body:
A physics-based cat sumo game featuring Nyanvys, cat-like creatures with long and noodly bodies.

This obscure game became momentairly famous for appearing in a [[Pakatube]] let's play featuring the [[Umamusume]] Sprinter Trio ([[Durandal (Umamusume)|]], [[Believe (Umamusume)|]] and [[Calstone Light O (Umamusume)|]]) as well as [[Seiun Sky (Umamusume)|]] and [[Narita Taishin (Umamusume)|]], two cat-like umamusumes. In fact, all posts of Nyaaaanvy in Danbooru pertain to this let's play.

title: gelgoog_marine
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]MS-14F Gelgoog Marine[/b]

A refitted, higher performing variant of the [[Gelgoog]] [[mobile suit]] designed for spec ops use. With more thruster power, beefier armor, arm-mounted guns, a spike shield for melee combat and a versatile array of weapons including two types of beam rifles and a more standard beam saber as opposed to the flashy [[beam_naginata|twin beam sword]]. 

It was truly a powerful machine even in the rapidly post-[[mobile_suit_gundam|One Year War]] escalating environment of "Operation Stardust".

body:

[b]Anavel Gato[/b] is a very skilled and dangerous [[Zeon]] ace pilot nicknamed "The Nightmare of Solomon" by [[Earth Federation]] pilots.

His second name is literally translated as "[[CAT]]" in the [[spanish_text|Spanish language]].

title: twenty-fifth_bam
body:
Twenty-Fifth Baam (스물다섯번째 밤, Seumooldahseotbeonjjae Bahm; "Twenty-Fifth Night") or simply Baam for short, is an Irregular and the main protagonist of [[Tower of God]]. Baam entered the Tower in search of his best and only friend, [[Rachel (Tower Of God)]] , another Irregular, who wanted to climb to the top of the Tower and see the stars.

Before entering the Tower, Baam had [[long hair]] and only wore a [[white robe]].

In Part I, Baam is a young boy with dark [[brown hair]] (often called [[black hair]]) and [[yellow eyes]]. He wears a [[brown shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[red vest]], and [[grey pants]]. After the Crown Game test he received the lowest tier Regular uniform, as well as a [[headband]] from Khun to cover his head injury. He is described as handsome and cute by the [[Black March (Tower Of God)]] , [[Ha Yuri Zahard]], [[Androssi Zahard]], and most recently [[Garam Zahard]]. Yuri also calls him a "hotty" in Part II. In Part III, Baam has grown out his hair slightly, with a [[short ponytail]].

Part I: 

● Initial Outfit: When he first comes into the Tower, he wears a [[white shirt]], a [[black sweater]], a [[red vest]], and [[grey pants]].

● Regular Uniform: After the events of the Crown Game, he wears a [[black headband]], a long black trench coat with gold lining, the Regular symbol, [[black pants]], and [[red shoes]].

● Combat Clothing: In the Hide-and-Seek test, Baam wears a long [[black coat]] with a loose ruffled [[turtleneck collar]], plain [[black pants]], and [[black shoes]].

body:

Hwa Ryun has [[red hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She is usually depicted wearing a [[pink sweater]] with a [[hood]], a [[black skirt]] with [[red leggings]] and some type of a [[eyepatch]] covering half her face (having lost her right eye to [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]] by mistake). She is a quiet person who says little and she has a gloomy and ominous aura. She is also quite manipulative, considering she was able to trick [[Khun Aguero Agnis]] into falling for[spoilers] [[Han Sung Yu]] 's plan to "push" [[Ho]] into taking some action against [[Rachel]].[/spoilers]

title: help:user_settings
body:
This page describes the settings on the [user settings page](/settings) and what they do.

h4. Basic Tab

* [b]Name[/b]
** Change your username.
* [b]Email[/b]
** Change your email address, or add one.
* [b]Theme[/b]
** Choose the site's color scheme.
** [b]Auto[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] inherits the color scheme from your device's settings.
* [b]Safe mode[/b]
** [b]True[/b] - Hides all non-{{rating:general|general}} posts. Equivalent to using "Donmai.moe":[https://donmai.moe]. 
** [b]False[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - All post rating levels will be displayed.
* [b]Posts per page[/b]
** Sets the max number of posts shown on a single page.
* [b]Default image width[/b]
** [b]Original[/b] - Will always show the full-size image.
** [b]850px[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - Will show the sample image by default with an option to view the full-size image.
* [b]Receive email notifications[/b] 
** [b]True[/b] - Receive an email when you get a new [[help:dmail|Dmail]].
** [b]False[/b] [tn](default)[/tn] - No emails will be sent.
* [b]Time Zone[/b]
** Sets how timestamps are displayed
** Affects how the [code]date:[/code] metatag works ("Help:Cheatsheet":[/wiki_pages/43049#dtext-n2-2-2])
** Default is Eastern Time (US & Canada)
* [b]Comment threshold[/b]
** Comments at or below this score will be hidden by default.
* [b]Blacklisted tags[/b]
** Put any tag combinations you never want to see here.
** Each combination should go on a separate line.
** You can also whitelist tags by adding a minus sign "-" in front.
** See [[help:blacklists|the help article]] for more information.

h4. Advanced Tab

* [b]Deactivate Account[/b]
** Permanently deactivate your account.
* [b]Disable tagged filenames[/b]
** Choose whether to include information identifying the copyright and characters of a post in the file name.
** Example when this setting is disabled: [__moriya_suwako_and_mononobe_no_futo_touhou_drawn_by_ritsuzou__8efb905b63d3d2641ac5afe893adbb7f.jpg](https://cdn.donmai.us/original/8e/fb/__moriya_suwako_and_mononobe_no_futo_touhou_drawn_by_ritsuzou__8efb905b63d3d2641ac5afe893adbb7f.jpg)
** Example when this setting is enabled: [8efb905b63d3d2641ac5afe893adbb7f.jpg](https://cdn.donmai.us/original/8e/fb/8efb905b63d3d2641ac5afe893adbb7f.jpg)
* [b]Custom CSS style[/b]
** Customize the way Danbooru looks with [CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS).
** Applies across platforms.
** See preset stylesheets by the community at [[about:custom css style]].

h4. Security Tab

* [b]Password[/b]
** Change your password.

[tn]...and other various settings (with description).[/tn]

title: quant_blitz
body:
Quant Blitz (퀀트 블릿츠, Kweont Blitseu) is a Ranker and the former Test Admin of the 2nd Floor along with [[Lero Ro]] . He is a character from [[Tower of God]] and his first appearance was in Season 1. 

Quant has [[red hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He has a darker skin colour compared to those of other characters. He is seen mostly wearing a white lab [[coat]] like Lero-Ro, but without the legs flared out.

He is essentially the classic maniac archetype, which is common for the Blitz Family. He has a short temper, is extremely cocky and overall is very childlike.

title: lero_ro
body:
[[Lero Ro]] is a character from [[Tower Of God]] and his first appearance was in Season 1. Lero-Ro (레로-로, Rehro-Ro; "Lero-Ro") is a Ranker and the former Test Admin of the 2nd Floor along with [[Quant Blitz]] .

He is a 2 meter tall, [[muscular]] human individual with [[blonde hair]] and two black spots under his eyes that show that he has undergone a special test. His choice of clothing was that of most Test Admins: a white lab [[coat]] with black [[pants]] and [[gloves]].

title: khun_hachuling
body:
Khun Hachuling, or simply just Hachuling (하츨링, Hahcheulling, Hachling, "Hachuling") from [[Tower of God]], is a Ranker, a defected member of the Khun Family and one of the numerous children related to [[Khun Edhuan]] . He is also a member of Wolhaiksong and is sometimes referred to as "Blueberry".

Similar to other members of the Khun Family, he appears to have [[pale skin]], pale [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

title: white_(tower_of_god)
body:
White (화이트, Hwaiteu) is the tenth Slayer of FUG,  one of the 2nd generation of Slayers, and until the latter events of the Hell Train, only his name and soul remained while his body had been lost. It was revealed during the Dallar Show that Hoaqin and his other siblings, in their combined form, was actually White. White was resurrected after Hoaqin and his Final Clone finally recombined.

In his prime, White's overall appearance is very similar to that of Hoaqin when he had absorbed three of his four siblings, with long flowing [[white hair]], an effeminately handsome visage, a flowing [[robe]] with ornate red markings and trimmings and two long white wing-like extensions of Shinsu that trails behind him. There are blood red marks besides his [[grey eyes]]/[[white eyes]], which he mentioned as the Blood Eye Paint. His [[sword]] has transformed once more, being longer with a uniquely-shaped tip.

title: po_bidau_gustang
body:
Po Bidau Gustang (포 비더 구스트앙, Po Bidder Gustang) is an Irregular and the Family Head of the Po Bidau Family. Tens of thousands of years ago, Gustang entered and climbed the Tower with [[Zahard]] and other 11 Great Warriors. After [[Zahard]] stopped their climb and decided to became the King of The Tower, Gustang created his own family and at some point in history, also married his fellow Great Warrior companion [[Eurasia Blossom]]. During The Great War conflict, he chose to remain loyal to [[Zahard]].

Along with the [[glasses]] he wears to better see the flow of [[shinsoo (tower of god)]] and elegant [[brunette hair]], he’s actually quite a handsome guy. His ex-wife [[Eurasia Blossom]] once commented on Gustang’s good looks: “Yeah, he’s like an elegant, ancient book... the same kind that makes you yawn after reading”. In his most recent appearance, he wore a smart white [[tuxedo]] with black [[lapels]], a dark [[grey shirt]] underneath and a [[black necktie]]. As shown from Traumerei’s memories of the distant past and his Data self, Gustang has a penchant for wearing white clothes and enjoys wearing [[suit]] .

title: lo_po_bia_traumerei
body:
Lo Po Bia Traumerei (로 포 비아 트로이메라이, Lo Po Bia Teuloimelai) was an Irregular and the Family Head of the Lo Po Bia Family.Tens of thousands of years ago, Traumerei entered and climbed the Tower with [[Zahard]] and other 11 Great Warriors. After [[Zahard]] stopped their climb and decided to became the King of The Tower, Traumerei created his own family. During The Great War conflict, he chose to remain loyal to [[Zahard]].

[Spoilers]Traumerei ended his own life after losing his Family Head status and the protection from the Administrator in the after-match of the war against [[Po Bidau Gustang]].[/spoilers]

Traumerei is a remarkably tall and well-built man, wearing a big [[black jacket]] that is left exposing the clothes he wears beneath them. He has [[green hair]] with [[blue pupils]]/[[green pupils]], and the majority of his face is covered in a [[mask]]. When he was climbing the Tower with his companions thousands of years prior, Traumerei has shown to have worn more [[casual clothes]], as shown where he wore simple [[jeans]] and a baggy-oversized [[hoodie]]. Later after completing the climb and prior to the official formation of the 10 Great Families, Traumerei wore more traditional [[robe]]s. He kept his hair much longer and styled much wilder and he did not wear his [[mask]].

title: lo_po_bia_elaine
body: Elaine is a tall decoratively dressed woman with long dark [[green hair]] that falls to around her knees and [[blue eyes]]/[[green eyes]]. She has fancy red earrings hanging from her ears and also a dark green [[tiara]] atop the crown of her head. Elaine wears a forest green coloured waistcoat-like [[garment]], fastened at her neck with a red [[gem]] [[brooch]], and [[green skirt]] with [[black pantyhose]] underneath. She wears forearm length gloves of similar colour and finally wears an all-encompassing dark [[cloak]] which covers most of her outfit and drapes along the ground behind her to some degree. As the Kaiser of the Name Hunt Station, she used to hide her face behind an ornate [[silver mask]] with red painted lips.

title: baylord_yama
body:
Baylord Yama (베이로드 야마, Bae’ee’rohdeu Yahmah) is a High Ranker and the seventh Slayer of FUG and is widely known as the King of Bayroad. Madoraco said Yama is one of the richest FUG Slayers, making his money with sports entertainment and secret gambling on the side. Baylord Yama has two brothers, an older brother and a younger one who serve as his second and third in command.

Baylord Yama has fair [[colored skin]] with long, wide and massive [[red hair]], and [[dog ears]]. His teeth are jagged and his [[yellow eyes]] have black marks around them. His height is over 270cm, taller than even King [[Zahard]], with well-build and [[muscular]] body.

title: chocolate
body:
[b]Chocolate[/b] comprises a number of raw and processed foods that are produced from the seed of the tropical cacao tree.

Chocolate has become one of the most popular flavors in the world. It is a common ingredient in many [[snack]]s and [[dessert]]s, including but not limited to [[cookie]]s, [[cake]]s, [[ice cream]], [[pudding]], [[pie]]s and [[candy]]. [[Gift]]s of chocolate molded into different shapes have become traditional on certain holidays: chocolate bunnies and eggs are popular on [[Easter]], chocolate coins on Hanukkah, Santa Claus and other holiday symbols on [[Christmas]], and hearts on [[valentine|Valentine's Day]]. Chocolate is also used in cold and hot beverages, including chocolate milk and hot chocolate.

title: afraid_of_monsters
body:
Afraid of Monsters is a 2005 psychological horror singleplayer game developed by Andreas Rönnberg. It was released as a [[Half-Life 1]] mod and remains as such to this day.

Afraid of Monsters stars [[David_Leatherhoff]], a drug addict who finds a bottle of painkillers regularly mailed to him by an unknown company. He quickly becomes addicted to these as well, but checks himself into a hospital for help. There, he finds another bottle of the same pills, and inevitably takes them -- to which he blacks out and wakes up in a now-abandoned hospital with roughly the same layout. 

The game revolves around David trying to overcome this addiction as he wanders from location to location and fighting strange monsters along the way. 

Notably, Andreas made this game entirely alone, and published it when he was 12. This caught the attention of some others, now joined in Team Psykslallar, who helped him further polish AoM and create a spiritual sequel. 

h4. See Also
* [[Cry of Fear]], a later [[Half-Life 1]] horror mod made by Andreas Rönnberg and Team Psykslallar.

title: exhibitionism
body:
A fetish involving exposing one's body, either partially or entirely, or to commit sexual acts in public areas. The participant is almost always willing and often makes an overt effort to gain the attention of onlookers.

While similar to (and often overlaps with) [[zenra]], exhibitionism differs from zenra in the emphasis on exposing private parts or sexual arousal from being seen by others, whereas zenra involves [[nude]] people doing various activities, sexual or not, as if it were a normal occurence.

This tag is applicable when:

* Character(s) is seen with exposed private parts and/or in nude in public places, willingly or not. 
* Character(s) is seen committed sexual acts within the presence of other people or the [[crowd]].
* Character(s) is overtly and actively exposing their nudity toward others (such as the viewer, etc.) or is aware of their state of nudity but does not attempt to cover it.
* Character(s) is wearing a clothes so revealing that it would exposes their private parts, especially in public places. Do not apply this tag simply because character is wearing [[revealing clothes]], only apply when character is shown to be attempting to garner attention or are aware that other people saw them.

This tag is [b]not[/b] applicable when:

* Character(s) is not in a public place. Selfies and livestreams should not get tagged.
* Character(s) is wearing [[revealing clothes]], but the setting is not in public or in other's presence, such as in a blank background.
* Blank background. Use [[flashing]] for that.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "[[nudist]]" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "exhibitionism" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "[[zenra]]" is applicable.

h4. Related tags

* [[public indecency]]
** [[public nudity]]
** [[public masturbation]]

title: han_sung_yu
body:
Yu Han Sung (유한성, Yoo Hahnseong; or "Yu Han-Sung") is an Advanced Ranker and the former Test Director of the Second Floor. He is a well-known Ranker partly because he declined to be a High Ranker. [Spoilers]He is a key member of FUG in capturing the Irregular [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]] and forced him to become a Slayer Candidate. He was the main antagonist of Part I. [/spoilers] He plays an important role as a character because he is well versed with several details surrounding the main story of Tower of God.

Yu Han Sung is portrayed as a man with long [[blonde hair]], with [[yellow eyes]] and quite feminine or, rather, [[androgynous]] features. He always wears a [[hanbok]], usually blue and yellow. He usually keeps his hair in a high [[hair bun]], with a traditional red [[hairpin]] sticking through the bun, which has the design of a butterfly on the end.

title: rak_wraithraiser
body:
Rak Wraithraiser (라크 레크레이셔, Rahk Rekraisher; or "Rac Wreckraiser") is a C-rank Regular from the Wraithraiser species. His position is Spear Bearer.[spoilers] He is a direct descendant of the Native One.[/spoilers]

Rak is originally a giant-size creature, a classic [[lizardman]], but after he mocked Ranker [[Han Sung Yu]] , the Second Floor Test Director, his body was shrunken intentionally by the Ranker. He eventually found out how to get back to his giant-size. He has [[red eyes] and [[black sclera]], with a [[head spikes]]/[[horns]].

 He wears [[red robe]]/[[armor]], a [[red cape]], (although he has been seen to change into a [[t-shirt]]) and carries a huge red [[spear]]. He is a large, powerful warrior and a very confident and optimistic individual.

title: cry_of_fear
body:
Cry of Fear is a 2012 psychological horror singleplayer game developed by Team Psykslallar. First created as a [[Half-Life 1]] mod, it was released officially on the Steam platform in 2013 thanks to Steam's Greenlight program.

The game stars [[Simon Henriksson]], a 19-year-old who opens the game with trying to help an injured man, and promptly getting hit by a car. He wakes up somewhere in Stockholm, Sweden's alleyways and tries to make his way home, but ends up chased by strange monsters and faced with horrific incidents. Along the way, he encounters [[Dr Purnell]] and his high school crush, [[Sophie (Cry Of Fear)|]], both of whom are directly tied to the game's four potential endings.

Cry of Fear used to have a multiplayer campaign that involved playing as a police officer who stumbled across Simon's alternate Sweden, rife with monsters, but these servers have since been shut down.

Characters:
* [[Simon Henriksson]] 
* [[Simon Henriksson (Book)]] 
* [[Dr Purnell]] 
* [[Sophie (Cry Of Fear)|]] 

h4. See Also
* [[Afraid of Monsters]], an earlier [[Half-Life 1]] horror mod by the same creator.

title: simon_henriksson
body:
Simon Henriksson is the 19-year-old, mentally ill protagonist of [[Cry of Fear]].

He lives in Stockholm, Sweden with his mother. Simon is typically dressed in a grey print hoodie with a shoulder bag. His common in-game weapons involve a phone, switchblade, firearm, and syringe. 

He will sometimes be depicted as his "true" self outside of the game's main plot, in which [spoiler] he is wheelchair bound [/spoiler].

title: toyosatomimi_no_miko
body:
The "Shoutoku Taoist". Stage 6 boss of the 13th [[Touhou]] game, [[Ten Desires]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]], [[Urban Legend In Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]] in which she dons a [[cape]]. Often seen with [[Mononobe No Futo]] and [[Soga No Tojiko]] from her game, and later her horse personified as [[Kurokoma Saki]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with two [[pointy hair|points]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears [[earmuffs]] (which are sometimes depicted as [[headphones]]), a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[yellow shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[purple skirt]] fastened with a [[black belt]], and [[yellow sandals]]. 

She carries a [[ritual baton]] and a [[sword]], with some Japanese fans assume it is "七星剣 ([i]Shichi-sei Ken[/i], Big Dipper Sword)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/七星剣], one of [[Shoutoku Taishi]]'s two famous swords. Its design was influenced by Taoism.

title: blau_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
The titular protagonist of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A masterless android who found an abandoned child and decided to raise him.
To do that, it starts wearing a female 'cyber-skin' and becoming the boy's mother, turning 'it' into a 'she'.

[[Rainy (mechanical buddy universe)|Rainy]] is her aforementioned adoptive son.

She is given the name "Blau" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

title: mononobe_no_futo
body:
"[i]Shikaisen[/i] from Ancient Japan".

Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]]. Appears to have developed a competitive rivalry and friendship with [[Kumoi Ichirin]] as a result of their partnership in [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

A [i]shikaisen[/i] who essentially abandoned her body into an object. She speaks in archaic Japanese, which is commonly depicted as [[Early Modern English Text|Early Modern English]] in translations. She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] under a [[blue hat|blue]] [[tate eboshi]] and [[grey eyes|grey]] or [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is similar to a [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom-adorned]] [[white robe|white]] [[kariginu]] sometimes with its [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves]] [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]], a [[blue skirt]], and [[blue boots]].

h4. See also

* Pool #16206 - Futo the Pyromaniac - Futo intentionally burning things for fun.
* [[Mononobe no Futo (chicken)]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Mononobe no Futo":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mononobe_no_Futo

title: ringo_(touhou)
body:
[b]The Orange Eagle Ravi[/b]

A [[moon rabbit]] and stage 2 boss of the 15th cardinal [[Touhou]] game, [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. She occupies the position of information management in the "Eagle Ravi" Earth investigation corps and has the ability to become stronger by eating [[dango]].

She has a [[brown hat|brown]] [[newsboy cap]], wears a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[orange shirt]] with a pair of [[yellow shorts]] and is depicted eating dango [[crossed_legs|cross-legged]] and [[barefoot]] in her portrait and sprite. Being a [[rabbit girl|moon rabbit]], she also has [[floppy ears|floppy]] [[rabbit ears]] and a [[rabbit tail]], with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]].

body:
A [[moon rabbit]], and the stage 1 boss of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. Featured on the cover of the demo disc.

She has [[red eyes]], [[blue_hair|dark-blue hair]] and [[rabbit ears]] with an [[earclip]] on her right ear, and is carrying a [[kine]] (a type of [[mallet]]) with purple stains (though they appeared to be [[ambiguous_red_liquid|red]] in the demo).

She is part of the covert operations department of the  "Eagle Ravi" Earth investigation corps. She has the ability to fire bullets from other dimensions and is paid low wages despite her dangerous work.

title: nippaku_zanmu
body: King of the Silent Bliss of Nirvana First appeared in [[Touhou]] [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] as the main antagonist, final boss for most routes, and playable character. Based on the Sengoku Era monk Nichihaku Zanmu, Zanmu is a human monk who turned into an oni. As an oni, she became one of Hell's most influential voices, being the one to propose the separation of Former Hell and New Hell. She has [[red eyes]], [[long_hair|long]], [[black hair]] with [[small horns|small]] [[yellow horns]]. She wears a [[green shirt]] and [[blue shorts]] with [[flip-flops]]. In UDoALG, she masterminded the events of the game in order to prevent the Animal Realm yakuza from triggering a total surface war with the Hell oni. By biding their time, the incident where the relinquished ownership rights of the surface naturally resolved itself. h4. Appearance * !post #6586897 * !post #9005207 h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Zanmu Nippaku":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Zanmu_Nippaku

title: nevada-tan
body:
[b]Nevada-tan[/b] is the name commonly used to describe an 11-year-old Japanese schoolgirl who was charged with murdering her classmate [[Mitarai Satomi]]. The murder occurred on June 1, 2004 at an elementary school in Sasebo, Japan and involved the slitting of Mitarai's throat and arms with a box cutter. It has come to be known as the "Sasebo Slashing". The unnamed killer (real name undisclosed by police for privacy reasons but fully broadcasted by Fuji TV while showing her drawings) has since become an internet meme cartoon character.

Nevada-tan's "name" comes from the University of Nevada hooded sweater she was wearing at the time.

This event was the inspiration behind the [[Vocaloid]] song [[Shoujo A (vocaloid)|]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sasebo slashing":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sasebo_slashing
* "Nevada-tan":http://web.archive.org/web/20070223200505/http://nevada.natural20.net/nevada.html on natural20 (Wayback Machine mirror)

title: florida_(location)
body:
Florida is a state in the [[United States]], located on a peninsula in the south-eastern corner of the country. Particularly known for it's year-round hot weather, [[palm tree]]s, and [[alligator]]s. It is also the location of [[NASA]]'s Kennedy Space Center, where most US rocket launches take place.

The state is particularly notorious in [[meme]] culture for "Florida Man" headlines, which describe bizarre (and usually drug-induced) crimes committed by Floridians.

H4. Tagged Locations
* [[Daytona International Speedway]]
* [[Hard Rock Stadium]]
* [[Miami]]
** [[Miami Beach]]
* [[Sebring International Raceway]]

h4. Tagged Sports Teams
* [[Florida Mayhem]] ([[Overwatch League]])
* [[Miami Heat]] ([[National Basketball Association]])
* [[Miami Marlins]] (Major League Baseball)

title: saigyouji_yuyuko
body:
The "Ghost of Flawless Immaculate Beauty". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Perfect Cherry Blossom]][/i] and later a recurring playable character in the earlier fighting games.

"Princess" of [[Hakugyokurou]], the netherworld pagoda, whose power to invoke death drove her to suicide when she was human, only to end up in [[Gensokyo]] without any memory of her past. 

Despite her tragic history, she often acts as a rather ditzy airhead, seemingly thinking of nothing but anticipating her meals, sleeping, and teasing her straight-laced bodyguard and gardener, [[Konpaku Youmu]]. All these facets, however, conceal an incredibly sharp mind to rival that of her closest friend, [[Yakumo Yukari]].

Depictions might show her with the cherry tree her body was buried under, the [[Saigyou Ayakashi]].

Non-ghost depictions of her can be found under [[Saigyouji Yuyuko (living)]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6476834

h4. See also

* [[Saigyouji Yuyuko's fan design]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Yuyuko Saigyouji":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuyuko_Saigyouji]

title: atlanta_hawks
body:
A Professional [[basketball]] team based in Atlanta, [[Georgia (State)|]]. Founded in 1946 as the Buffalo Bison, they've played in Milwaukee, and St. Louis before settling in Atlanta. The Hawks have played in 4 NBA Finals, winning one in 1958. Despite a long Championship drought, they have one of the most playoff appearances in the association.

Notable current and former players include [[Trae Young]], Zaccharie Risacher, [[Dejounte Murray]] Vince Carter, Jeff Teague, Bob Pettit, and Dominique Wilkins

Their uniforms include the main colors of Red, Black and Yellow, with gray accents. The main home uniforms are Black with yellow Lettering and Red Trimming. Their away uniforms are White with Red Lettering and Red and white trimming. Their alternate uniforms are Red with white Lettering and Red Trimming. The Logo is line silhouette of a Hawk. The Logo is known as the Pac logo, looking like silhouette of [[Pac-man]].

h4. See also 

* [[National Basketball Association]]

h4. External links

* "Team website":[https://www.nba.com/hawks/]
* "Wikipedia: Atlanta Hawks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlanta_Hawks]


h1. See Also 
[[National Basketball Association]]

title: new_england_patriots
body:
One of the 32 teams making up the [[National Football League]]. The Patriots, based in Foxboro, Massachusetts, play in the East Division of the American Football Conference.

Used to be universally hated by other fan bases due to their domination of the league during a 20 year span from 2000 to 2020, coinciding with the tenure of quarterback [[Tom Brady]]. 

This is no longer the case as Tom Brady left the team in 2020 and the Patriots have been terrible since. The team is now headed by Drake Maye

title: automaton_(object)
body:
An automaton is a relatively self-operating machine, or control mechanism designed to automatically follow a sequence of operations, or respond to predetermined instructions. Some automata, such as bellstrikers in mechanical clocks, are designed to give the illusion to the casual observer that they are operating under their own power or will, like a mechanical robot. The term has long been commonly associated with automated puppets that resemble moving humans or animals, built to impress and/or to entertain people.

Animatronics are a modern type of automata with electronics, often used for the portrayal of characters or creatures in films and in theme park attractions. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automaton

title: merasmus
body:
Merasmus, also known as Merasmus the Magician, is one of the three secondary antagonists (alongside Redmond Mann and Blutarch Mann) of the [[Team Fortress 2| Team Fortress]] franchise, serving as the main antagonist of its annual Scream Fortress event and a major character in the comics.

He is the RED Soldier's former roommate-turned arch-nemesis, and keeper of the Bombinomicon, a magic talking book of spells.

He was voiced by Nolan North

https://villains.fandom.com/wiki/Merasmus

body:
The basic form of [[Kamen Rider Kuuga]].
The armors on the torso and shoulders, eyes are red. The gems on [[Arcle (Kuuga)|]] buckle, [[forehead jewel|forehead]], bracelets and anklets are also [[red gemstone|red]]. 
It does not use weapons, but performs hand-to-hand combat.

This form's special move, the [b]Mighty Kick[/b], is a right-footed [[flying kick]] with [[flaming foot|flame-like]] Seal Energy.

title: final_fantasy
body:
A popular, long-running role-playing game series by [[Square Enix]].

Final Fantasy first appeared in 1987 in reaction to Enix's [[Dragon Quest]]. Contrarily to what is often said, while Square wasn't doing great at the time, the first game wasn't made as a last ditch attempt to save the company. It did end up being a great commercial success and as a result, subsequent titles (each set in a different universe) were published ever since.

When tagging the first game, use [[Final Fantasy I]].

title: chacha_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[GUDAGUDA Meiji Ishin]] event. She is [[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|]]'s niece (and by extension [[Oda Nobukatsu (fate)|]]'s as well), and was the consort for [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi (fate)|]]. [[Shusha (fate)|Toyotomi Tsurumatsu]] is their son. She is known to have an insatiable desire for money. For some reason, she has been summoned as a child rather than as her adult self, "Yodo-dono":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yodo-dono.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Pako (pakosun)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Asumi Kana]]

title: uther_pendragon_(fate)
body:
The father of [[saber_(fate)|Artoria Pendragon]] and [[Morgan le Fay_(fate)|]] in Proper Human History.

Different from Proper Human History, in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [i][[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]][/i] chapter he was a king who united humans and fairies by marrying the fairy Mab. He was killed at his coronation, and died in [[Aesc_(fate)|]]'s arms. Due to the lack of design, he was represented as a Shadow Servant using [[Arthur Pendragon (fate)|]]'s sprite, named "Knight of Londinium". As a result, fanart of Uther often borrows his design.
other_names: ウーサー・ペンドラゴン
ロンディニウムの騎士

title: rip_van_winkle_(hellsing)
body:
[[waffen-ss|SS]] Obersturmführer (First Lieutenant) Rip Van Winkle is a major antagonist in the [[Hellsing]] series. She is one of [[Millenium (hellsing)|Millennium's]] top soldiers and a member of the Werwolf Squad, Rip Van Winkle, commands her troops to steal an aircraft carrier called the Eagle from the British. A powerful woman carrying with her a great Musket capable of firing Magic Bullet《魔弾, Madan》 whose target is unfaltering, she has served under The Major since World War II and was praised by The Major for her ability to defy the laws of nature and defeat multiple enemies with a single shot, likening it to Carl Maria von Weber's [[opera]] "Der Freischütz." Rip Van serves her mission with pride and unwavering conviction; however, she is vulnerable to unexpected situations and prone to panic. 

h4. Appearance 
* !post #2163251

https://hellsing.fandom.com/wiki/Rip_Van_Winkle
other_names: リップヴァーン・ウィンクル

title: tannhauser_(opera)
body:
Tannhäuser (full title: Tannhäuser und der Sängerkrieg auf Wartburg, "Tannhäuser and the Minnesängers' Contest at Wartburg") is an 1845 [[opera]] in three acts, with music and text by Richard Wagner (WWV 70 in the catalogue of the composer's works). It is based on two German legends: Tannhäuser, the mythologized medieval German Minnesänger and poet, and the tale of the Wartburg Song Contest. The story centres on the struggle between sacred and profane love, as well as redemption through love, a theme running through most of Wagner's work.

The opera remains a staple of major opera house repertoire in the 21st century. 


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tannh%C3%A4user_(opera)

title: anna_miller
body:
While Anna Miller originally was an 18th century English writer and salon hostess, there is also an "Anna Miller's" chain of restaurants in Hawaii and Japan, known for their breakfast menus and desserts.

Also notable in the restaurants in Japan are the uniforms of their [[waitress]]es. Such a uniform consists of a pink or orange overall-style dress (waistline cut to the [[breasts]]) with an attached [[apron]], a white [[blouse]], and a heart-shaped [[name tag]]. It is this uniform which this tag refers to.

Anna Miller's last physical restaurant in Japan closed down on August 31, 2022, after which the Japanese franchise existed as an online shop.

h4. See also

* [[Kobeya]] - another chain known for their waitress uniforms
* [[List of Uniforms]]
* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":http://www.annamillersrestaurant.com/
* "Official Japanese website":http://www.annamillersrestaurant.jp/

title: los_angeles_dodgers
body:
The Los Angeles Dodgers are an American professional [[baseball]] team based in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]]. Originally based in [[new york city|Brooklyn, New York]] (known simply as the [i]Brooklyn Dodgers[/i]), they moved to Los Angeles in 1958 and have achieved a somewhat legendary status since. The Dodgers compete in Major League Baseball as a member club of the National League West division.

Additionally, they did a collaboration with [[Hololive]] on 5 July, 2024, involving [[Usada Pekora]], [[Gawr Gura]], and [[Hoshimachi Suisei]]. The following year on 5 July, 2025, there was another Hololive collaboration featuring [[Koseki Bijou]], [[Ninomae Ina'nis]], and [[IRyS (Hololive)]] .

h4. See also

* [[Los Angeles Angels]]
* [[Tulsa Drillers]] (the Dodger's minor league affiliate team)
* [[Ootani Shouhei]]

title: trollface_(character)
body:
One of the oldest and most well-known [[Rage Comic]] faces. Drawn in 2008 by Carlos "Whynne" Ramirez to represent internet trolls, though it's just as often adopted by trolls themselves; as of the early 2020s it's also been depicted as a sort of dangerous [[cryptid]] called "Trollge".

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Trollface":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trollface
* "KnowYourMeme: Trollface":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/trollface
* "Archive of the original DeviantArt post":https://web.archive.org/web/20200220030016/https://www.deviantart.com/whynne/art/Comic-Trolls-98357844

title: troll_face
body:
An [[tag group:face tags|expression]] meant to elicit the same raging anger that its namesake activity causes. Usually portrayed as semicircular eyes (upper half exposed) and a [[smirk]] or open [[smile]], giving the impression that the person is almost goofily gloating about their victory over your sensibilities.

May also refer to a [[meme]]tic image from [[rage comic]] of [[Trollface (Character)|a face]] with a wide, annoying grin, to which the word "troll face" is nowadays associated with.

Not the same thing as [[doyagao]], which is a look of [[smug]] self-satisfaction at something impressive that's been done. Troll face is more a [[sneer]] of schadenfreude at something that's been done to another person. 

h4. See also

* [[doyagao]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: the_o_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

The [b]PMX-003 The O[/b] is [[Paptimus Scirocco]]'s personal [[mobile suit]] designed by him. Its colossal size and girth deceivingly hide its impressive maneuverability, courtesy of countless [[vernier thrusters]] of various sizes all over the unit. 

As if that wasn't enough, it loads a massively powerful [[beam rifle]], as well as two [[extra arms]] hidden in the front skirt that can wield beam sabers of their own and overwhelm enemy units in combat. 

For defense, it has a thick armor (which gave the MS its known size as said above) which can withstand both solid and beam weaponry[spoiler], but not [[watermelon bar]]s[/spoiler].

h4. See also
* [[Xeku Eins]] - A mass produced MS with a similar design.
* [[Over.On]]
* [[The O ii]]

title: elfinpsyop
body:
A female [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]] English-language [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]].

Elfin is a cyborg elf with [[messy hair|messy]] [[black hair]] with viridian green streaks, two big [[twin braids]], and an erected [[ahoge]] between her [[mechanical antennae]]. She's seen to have a [[USB symbol]] icon marked on her right cheek, as well as hunter [[green eyes]] with dark circles under them.

She often wears a long gray [[trollface (character)|]] t-shirt with her left shoulder exposed and a pair of [[black thighhighs]]. Her fingers and forearms are riddled with [[bandages]].

title: zaku_ii_f2
body:
A fictional antagonist [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]MS-062F Zaku II F2[/b]

A basic upgrade to the [[Zaku II]] produced by [[Zeon]], with standardized armament, beefier armor, and a new set of verniers for extra mobility in space. It was not produced in massive numbers, and most [[mobile_suit|MS]] units fell in the hands of the [[Earth Federation]] to be used as training suits.

Unnamed anime-only [[Umamusume]] character. Most 'famous' for giving [[Team Spica's Trainer]] a kick to the face at the end of Season 1 Episode 13.

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] (sometimes [[blue hair|bluish-grey]]) hair, with a single [[white hair|white]] forelock. Wears an [[orange bow|orange]] [[ear bow]] on [b]her right ear[/b]. Highly resembles an older version of [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]].
