title: player_2
body:
Videogame character [[palette swap|color swap]], or a parody thereof. Originated in fighting games, so that if both players chose the same character, they could still be easily distinguished. 

This tag is intended for all alternate palettes that appear in fighting games not just the second option. 
 
If more than just the base color changes use [[Official Alternate Costume]].
If it is a different character (echo fighter, dark persona) use the proper character tag.
If the color is official but not from a video game use [[Official Alternate Color]].


h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: bokusatsu_tenshi_dokuro-chan
body:
[[Kusakabe Sakura]] a mere junior high student, has committed a horrible crime. Or, rather, he will commit a crime—20 years into the future. The crime in question? He will prevent all women from developing past the age of 12, with immortality as an unintended side effect. As a result, the angel [[Mitsukai Dokuro]] is sent from the future as an assassin, armed with with a magical spiked bat named Excalibolg. However, rather than kill him, Dokuro wants to take a different approach. She resolves to be a constant nuisance to Sakura, in an attempt to prevent him from focusing on anything long enough to create his criminal technology.

With Dokuro going against orders, the angel [[Mihashigo Sabato]] is sent out to complete Dokuro's mission. Between the impulsive Dokuro—who often murders Sakura with her bat before reviving him with the magic words "Pipiru piru piru pipiru pi"—and the electric baton-wielding Sabato, Sakura's life will never be peaceful again.
other_names: 撲殺天使ドクロちゃん

title: glowie_(meme)
body:
Slang term popular on [[4chan]]'s /pol/ board used in reference to CIA or other governmental agents posing as ordinary 4chan users in order to bait others into sharing incriminating information. It is also used to call out potential bait posts made by agents in an insulting way. The term originates from schizophrenic computer programmer and YouTuber [[Terry A. Davis]], who claimed in 2017 that CIA agents glow in the dark. Glowposting is also used to refer to agents who post bait content.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/glowie-glowposting

title: templeos
body: TempleOS (also called: J Operating System, LoseThos, and SparrowOS) is a biblical-themed lightweight operating system (OS) designed to be the Third Temple prophesied in [[the Bible]]. It was created by American programmer [[Terry A. Davis]], who developed it alone over the course of a decade after a series of manic episodes that he later described as a revelation from God.

title: terry_a._davis
body:
[b]Terrence Andrew Davis[/b] was an American programmer who created and designed the operating system [[TempleOS]].

On the evening of August 11, 2018, while walking alongside railroad tracks in The Dalles, Oregon, Davis was struck and killed by a Union Pacific train. Investigators could not determine whether his death was suicide or accidental, although the train engineer believed his death to be a suicide. The police report stated that Davis was walking with his back toward the train and that he turned around before the moment of impact.

h4. See also
* [[Linux]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Terry A. Davis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_A._Davis]

title: adult_swim
body:
The nighttime programming block on [[Cartoon Network]]. As the name implies, this focuses on adult (non-pornographic) American cartoons (some original, some from other channels), as well as a couple of anime thrown into the mix (since 2012 under the [[Toonami]] label).

The network's name is stylized as [adult swim] (with brackets included).

h4. Animated programs

title: pinocchio_(lies_of_p)
body:
The main character of [[Lies of P]]. As his name suggests, he is inspired by [[Pinocchio (The Adventures Of Pinocchio)|Pinocchio]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[freckles]], and a [[single mechanical arm]]. While his starting outfit has him wearing a [[white shirt]], the cover art has him wearing a [[blue coat]] with a [[white ascot]], [[red vest]], [[shoulder strap]], and a [[brooch]].

[spoiler] After a certain point in the game, once he gains enough humanity, his hair grows to [[medium hair|medium length]]. After obtaining [[Sophia Monad|Sophia Monad's]] Ergo, his hair turns [[grey hair|grey]].

title: teeth
body:
Small, whitish structures found inside one's jaw. Teeth are used to bite, to break down food before they are swallowed, and many other functions including self-defense.

In most drawings the teeth would usually be excluded from the picture unless it is a [[grin]], [[crying]], [[biting]] or others. Use this tag when the teeth are prominent.

title: inconvenient_breasts
body:
Opposite of [[convenient breasts]].

When [[breasts]] are so large that they get in the way by getting stuck, ruining clothes, knocking things over, impeding line of sight, or even accidentally whacking someone on the head. Apparently there can be too much of a good thing.

This tag can also apply to breasts being too small if smaller sizes are a detriment in some scenario. Please do not confuse with [[breast envy]].

h4. See Also
* [[inconvenient pectorals]]

* [[undersized clothes]]

title: water_cooler_(deltarune)
body:
It's simply a water cooler, an enemy encounter from DELTARUNE Chapter 3. It is only capable of attacking and saying various misspellings of the word bubble, but according to a random "NPC":[https://deltarune.wiki/w/Watercooler#cite_note-1] in the same chapter, it is a sentient creature. More specifically, a transformed version of a Mizzle, an enemy from a later Chapter in the same game.
The water coolers are a common joke within the fandom for having unreasonably hard-to-dodge attacks.

title: backscratcher
body:
A backscratcher (also known as a scratch-back or a back scratcher) is a tool used for relieving an itch in an area that cannot easily be reached just by one's own hands, typically the back.

They are generally long, slender, and rod-shaped, with a knob on one end for holding and a rake-like device, sometimes in the form of a human hand, on the other end to perform the actual scratching.  Some variants feature massage rollers or a massage ball on the end opposite from the rake.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backscratcher

title: party_parrot_(meme)
body:
The Party Parrot is a meme based on an emoticon of a gyrating rainbow [[kakapo]], itself based on Sirocco, a kakapo who "infamously tried to copulate with a zoologist's head on TV.":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9T1vfsHYiKY]. Naturally, there are numerous variants of the Party Parrot.

In Japan, the meme evolved into the TINTIN parrot, short videos where a Party Parrot teaches a random subject to four other Party Parrots, all speaking with the same English TTS voice regardless of whether or not they are actually speaking English (to hilarious results). Every few words, the class is interrupted whenever someone says [[penis|"TINTIN"]] (and other variants) or something similarly dirty as they proceed to animate to music (typically Night of Fire by Niko).

h4. See also

* "Cult of the Party Parrot":[https://cultofthepartyparrot.com/] (Source of the emotes)
* "Shagged by a rare parrot":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9T1vfsHYiKY] (Origin of the meme)
* "The Original TINTIN parrot":[https://twitter.com/FUCKDESUNE/status/1248815824946651137] (Compare with the template below)
* "Several examples of the TINTIN parrot":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MnJgrTQnT1g]

title: ollanius_persson
body:
Ollanius Pius was born as one of the mysterious Perpetuals and has lived so many lives that he has forgotten his true age. However, he estimates that as of the Horus Heresy, he was roughly 45,000 years old "give or take", which would place his birth around 15,000 B.C. in the city of Nineveh.

If this is to be believed, it would make him even older than the Emperor, who, according to older sources, was born around 8,000 B.C..

Having lived through all of recorded human history, he makes first-hand reference to historical and mythological events such as the being one of the Argonauts, participating in the Battle of Austerlitz (during the Napoleonic Wars), the Siege of Verdun (during the First World War), and the Battle of 73 Easting (during the Gulf War), amongst others. During his long life, he even acted as the Emperor's original Warmaster on prehistoric Earth.

During the Horus Heresy, he became involved in the battle against Horus following the Battle of Calth and worked with John Grammaticus to reach Terra.

[spoiler]He ultimately gave his life protecting the Emperor from Horus aboard the Vengeful Spirit in the Siege of Terra.[/spoiler]

title: neuro-sama
body:
An English-speaking [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] entirely powered by artificial intelligence under [[Vedal AI]]. Created by osu! streamer [[Vedal987]], she can respond to chat messages using a large language model and play video games such as [[osu!]] and [[Minecraft]]. 
Illustrated by [[anyuu|annytf]].

Her gameplaying part is written in Python, while her chatbot part is written in C#.

She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] light [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair between eyes|hair between her eyes]] and [[two side up|two side ups]] held by [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]] and a [[heart hair ornament|heart-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[school uniform]]: a [[yellow cardigan|yellow]] [[v-neck]] cardigan with [[long sleeves]] reaching [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]], with an [[aqua bowtie]] over a [[serafuku]] with [[grey sailor collar|grey]] or [[blue sailor collar]] and a [[grey skirt|grey]] or [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]]; [[uneven legwear]] with a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]], [[black socks|black]] [[single sock|kneehigh]] and a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid on her knee]]; and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Her accessories include a [[red bag|red]] [[duffel bag|gymbag]] or [[shoulder bag]], and many [[button badge|button badges]] in the shapes of a heart, a star, a turtle, a drone and an osu! #1 badge.

h4. Costumes

* !post #2151781: [[Momose Hiyori]]
* !post #6349158: Original default
* !asset #25143537: Current default

h4. See also

* [[Evil Neuro-sama]]: Dark persona and twin sister
* [[swarm drone (neuro-sama)|The Swarm]] - Her fanbase often represented as flying gymbag [[drone|drones]].

h4. External links
* [https://twitch.tv/Vedal987](Twitch)

* "Twitter (Neuro-sama)":[https://twitter.com/NeurosamaAI]

title: ollanius_piers
body:
Ollanius Piers was an Imperial Army trooper of the Hundred and Fifth Tercio Upland Grenadiers Regiment during the Siege of Terra. During the battle for the Eternity Wall Spaceport, he was interviewed by Historian Hari Harr.

Piers recounted his battle for the Pons Solar bridge, where he stood before a World Eater until Jenetia Krole arrived to dispatch the traitor. Thinking the story lacked enough significance, Harr changed the World Eater to Warmaster Horus himself.

[spoiler]Later, as the Eternity Wall Spaceport fell, Piers stood his ground against Angron and was slain.[/spoiler]

title: saint_ollanius_pius
body:
Ollanius Pius is a legendary figure, said to be a Guardsman who sacrificed his life to save the Emperor during the Siege of the Imperial Palace. He is considered a Saint within the Imperial Guard and his image is often displayed on regimental banners.

The Order of Ollanius Pius is the highest military honour awarded in the Imperial Guard.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] with [[sidelocks]], [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] ([[large breasts|large]] in her [[Foxhound (retrofit) (azur lane)|Retrofit]]). Her outfit consists of a [[white tube top|white]] [[tube top]], [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 120 mm single gun mounts and two 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], held on two separate hull pieces with her ship's badge and attached to a funnel to her back.

title: mysterious_heroine_x_alter_(fate)
body:
A Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who is the [[dark persona|alter]] version of [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]].

Unlike other versions of [[Saber Alter]], Heroine X Alter retains [[Saber (fate)|]]'s iconic [[ahoge]] while wearing her school uniform. While her initial appearance is heavily influenced by [[Master Artoria]] (along with [[glasses]] for extra appeal), her later ascensions make her look more like a Sith Lord from [[Star Wars]], complete with Force lightning and dual-bladed lightsaber.

Gained an idol version called [[Mysterious Idol X Alter (fate)|]] for the Grail Live! event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BUNBUN]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: king_hassan_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The Old Man of the Mountain, and founder of the Hassan-i-Sabbah sect of assassins. His identity and existence are obscure even to his followers; the only proof he exists is when he executes a Hassan for straying from the intended path, along with any witnesses who see him.

Appears as a tall man in a jet black [[full armor]] with [[horns|horned]] [[skull mask]].

Named [b]First Hassan[/b] in the English version. Humorously, his voice actor is [[Nakata Jouji]], who also voices [[Kotomine Kirei]] (and once had a Hassan as his Servant).

He is usually depicted as a strict moral guardian who adheres by his own code of honor, and often cannot tolerate seeing any woman wearing [[revealing clothes]], though is generally very kind to those he deemed good or innocent, especially children.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ryota-H]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Nakata Jouji]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #8992411: First Ascension
* !post #3380514: Second Ascension
* !post #4970218: Third Ascension

title: drawbread
body:
This type of sandwich was originally seen in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]]. To test their current luck when it comes to drawing cards, duelists at the Duel Academy would try their luck with Drawbread. It comes in a variety of flavors, with the golden eggwich being the luckiest flavor to obtain, as the golden hen that lays it only once a day.

Later becomes a spell card in the [[Duel Monster|card game]].

title: aleksander_sliwka
body:
Aleksander Śliwka is a Polish volleyball player who plays on the Polish Men's National Volleyball Team.

He played in Japan for Suntory Sunbirds Osaka during the 2024/25 season. Previously, he spent five seasons with Grupa Azoty ZAKSA Kędzierzyn-Koźle in Poland.

title: arceus
body:
A Normal-type Mythical [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0493 in the National Pokédex.

A white, quadrupedal creature with [[red eyes]], [[green sclera]]e, and a large, oddly-shaped ornament around its waist. It can change its type with the use of a [[Plate (pokemon)|]] or [[Z-Crystal]].

Known as the [b]Original One[/b], as it is said that it created the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] universe. It is also the creator of six other Pokémon: [[Uxie]], [[Mesprit]], [[Azelf]], [[Dialga]], [[Palkia]], and [[Giratina]].

Japanese name: [b]Arceus[/b]

title: hooters
body:
An American [[restaurant]] franchise, infamous for their [[waitress]]es: young, [[large breasts|well-endowed]] women wearing a [[employee uniform|uniform]] of tight, [[cleavage|low-cut]] white Hooters [[tank top]]s with [[pantyhose|sheer/orange pantyhose]] under orange runner's [[short shorts]]. Their waitresses are known as "Hooters Girls" and their company slogan is "Delightfully tacky, yet unrefined". Despite popular depictions of such, a Hooter's uniform is not allowed to expose [[midriff]].

title: yougou_doushirou
body:
A [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage]] character.

A member of [[Onigawara Bombers]] that operates under the name "NiHachi". He is a cook at a soba restaurant. He has a lot of admiration for the leader of his group, [[Hoozuki Jinpachi]], and tends to be a little strict with [[Komagata Masamune]]. He is treated as the younger brother of his group and, due to that young age, he has a tendency to lose his temper and often yells at rude people.

title: komagata_masamune
body:
A [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage]] character.

A member of [[Onigawara Bombers]] that operates under the name "Bacchus". Cheerful and carefree; He is the owner of a liquor store and an avid drinker with the ability to drink large bottles of sake in one go.

He refers to [[Hoozuki Jinpachi]] as "Jin-chan" and [[Kannonzaka Doppo]] as "Kannonzaka-chan".

title: hoozuki_jinpachi
body:
A [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage]] character.

Operates as the leader of [[Onigawara Bombers]] under the name "Demon's Fire". He is a master carpenter who loves his hometown of Asakusa and seems to be trusted by the locals. He has a strong desire to protect his city, but also isn't eager to fight with people he has no involvement with.

title: onigawara_bombers
body: A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic: Rule the Stage]] that represents the Asakusa division. It consists of [[Hoozuki Jinpachi]], [[Komagata Masamune]], and [[Yougou Doushirou]]. They were originally just members of an amateur baseball team prior to the events of Track 2.

title: funnels_(gundam)
body:
A funnel-shaped drone unit, from the [[Gundam]] franchise, that is designed to be remotely controlled by a Newtype pilot.

It is equipped with a small beam cannon, and an energy cell to propel the funnel when it is operating. A Newtype pilot is able to control these funnels with great precision, allowing them to remotely attack an enemy from all directions, making a funnel-equipped mobile suit extremely deadly. When the funnels are not in use, they are attached to the mother suit's surface hardpoints for recharging.

Although early funnels can indeed resemble funnels, they can come in a variety of shapes. 

Funnels also has multiple variations throughout the Gundam metaverse: 
* [[Bit (gundam)|]]s (Its larger predecessor which are equipped with on-board generators, eliminating the need to re-dock with the mother suit for recharging; non-UC versions, however, functions like a funnel due to their need for recharging)
* [[Incom (gundam)|]]s (A wire-controlled variation)
* [[Fin Funnels]] (Miniaturized bits used by the [[Nu Gundam]]/[[Hi-Nu Gundam]])
* Shield Funnels ([[Unicorn Gundam]]'s shields, each equipped with a beam gatling gun; its function as remote weapons is only available if the Unicorn is on its Awakened [[NT-D]] Mode; [[Unicorn Gundam Phenex]] has a variant which lacks the beam gatling gun attachment and its form of offense is ramming onto targets; it is also equipped with tail stabilizers)
* [[Psycho Plates]] (Remote controlled Newtype weapons used by the [[Moon Gundam (Mobile Suit)|]], inherited from the [[Psycho Gundam Mk-IV G-Doors]])
* Funnel Missiles (Equipped on both [[Penelope (Hathaway's Flash)|]] and [[Xi Gundam]], this type of funnels functions like remote controlled missiles, guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact)
* DRAGOONs (a.k.a. Disconnected Rapid Armament Group Overlook Operation Network, exclusive in [[Gundam SEED]], including its sequels and spinoffs)
* Fangs (exclusive in [[Gundam 00]] and [[Gundam 00 A Wakening of the Trailblazer]])

This type of weapon is not only exclusive to the Gundam franchise (although it has variety of names and different technology if it shows up in series unrelated to Gundam). Examples are [[Nirvash|Nirvash Spec-V/V3]]'s Options, [[Tauburn (Star Driver)|]]'s Piles, [[Armored Core]]'s Orbit Cannons and Exceed Orbit, [[Takamachi Nanoha]]'s Blaster Bits and [[Eva 13]]'s RS Hoppers.

title: odin_(mythology)
body: The All Father and head of the Teutonic Pantheon, know by many names. He has one eye after sacrificing his other to obtain knowledge of life and death, throwing it down the well of fate. He is often seen holding his spear Gungnir his ring Draupnir and accompanied by his ravens [[Huginn (Mythology)|]] and [[Muninn (Mythology)|]], his wolves [[Geri (mythology)|]] and [[Freki (mythology)|]], and his 8 legged horse [[Sleipnir (Mythology)|]].

She wears a [[crop top|crop]][[cropped hoodie|pped]] [[orange hoodie]], [[blue jacket]], and [[black pants]] [[torn pants|torn]] at the knees. title: black_hair_twintail_girl_(ichiki_1)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[ichiki_1]].

A friend of [[Tsukimi Yoruha]]. She is often referred to by the author as "black-hair-twintails-chan". Her name has not yet been divulged. [[ichiki_1]] has stated on Twitter that these two girls are not sisters.

She has [[pink eyes]] (sometimes drawn as [[purple eyes|purple]]), [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]]. Often wears [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair]] [[ribbon]]s, a [[black choker]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black tank top|black]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[tank top]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[wristband]], and a [[white belt]].

He is often drawn to look like a sickly and/or disheveled version of his younger brother.

title: philopon
body:
Also known as hiropon or shabu. The brand-name [[methamphetamine]] sold by Dainippon Pharmaceuticals for civilian and military use. (At the time, the side effects of methamphetamine were not well studied.)
After [[World War II]] a large military stockpile of Philopon flooded the market. The Japanese government banned it in 1951.
This tag is usually used for east-asian methamphetamine in the war years and the immediate postwar years.

h6.Philopon abusers in manga/anime

* [[musubi_(hadashi_no_gen)|Musubi]] ([[Hadashi no Gen]])
* [[Innami Zen'ichi]] ([[Gambler Densetsu Tetsuya]] / Tetsuya-Jansei to Yobareta Otoko)

title: kfp
body:
The [[fast food]] chain that [[Takanashi Kiara]] owns, a spoof of [[KFC]]. Her YouTube members are referred to as "employees," while they refer to Kiara as "Tenchou" (manager).

Due to Kiara humorously adopting a persona that runs the gamut from "passive aggressive" to "flat-out yandere" when acting as manager of KFP, it has been joked that KFP is just a cover for a cult, and that employees who displease Kiara, such as by not letting her win in [[Super Mario Kart]] or by shipping [[Mori Calliope]] with anyone other than Kiara, get punished for their insubordination by being turned into the food sold at KFP.

[[Chicken]]s, hens, and [[rooster]]s of various kinds are often used to represent [[kfp employee (takanashi kiara)|Kiara's fanbase/KFP's employees]].

title: ali_(sotcho)
body:
An original character created by [[sotcho]]. 

[b]Ali[/b] is a [[tall female|tall]], [[muscular female|heavily muscular]] [[dragon girl|dragon woman]] with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[black horns|short black horns]], [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[slit pupils|eyes]], [[pointy ears|sharp ears]], and [[huge breasts|a significantly large bust]]. She is acquainted with [[ziyu_(sotcho)|Ziyu]], another individual of the same race as her.

She often wears [[earrings]] and a black [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]]. She is also about 228.6cm, or 7.5 feet tall at head height, according to post #5887286.

title: shirai_sae
body: Character in [[Kodomo no Jikan]], a stern teacher often at ends with enthusiastic, newcomer [[Aoki Daisuke]], as well as peers [[Houin Kyouko]] and [[oyajima_(kodomo_no_jikan)|Oyajima]]. Often clothed as one may expect of an office lady, she later sports a shorter, looser haircut and opens up more to the other teachers and some students (namely [[Kagami Kuro]]).

title: mary_janes
body:
A style of women's [[shoes]] characterized by a single strap across the top of the foot in place of laces or a zipper. Usually [[black footwear|black]], short-heeled or [[flats|flat]], and very smooth-featured, with a simple buckle to hold the strap tight. Commonly seen on [[school uniform]]s, [[lolita fashion]], and fetish porn stars.

Not to be confused with [[loafers]] which can also have a strap but running over a leather top. See the example post.

Not to be confused with [[uwabaki]], which are indoor shoes used in Japanese schools.

h4. Examples

* !post #6381293
* !post #8440866
* !post #1132658: Left are [[loafers]], right are Mary Janes.

h4. See also
* [[Loafers]]
* [[T-bar sandals]]
* [[Uwabaki]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

h4. External links

* "Example":https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Start-rite_Louisa_traditional_bar_shoes_or_%22Mary-Jane%22_shoes.jpg

title: tales_of_destiny_2
body:
The fourth mothership title in Namco's [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series for the Playstation 2 and rereleased on the Playstation Portable. It was never localized to the West, and is the first game to use Grade as a form of endgame currency. It is a direct sequel to [[Tales of Destiny]], starring Stahn Aileron's son Kyle Dunamis.

TOD2 is not to be confused for the renamed title of [[Tales of Eternia]] in the West due to copyright reasons. This tag is for the Tales of Destiny sequel.

title: professor_niyaniya_(blue_archive)
body:
"Smiling Professor," known in the English translation of the game as "Professor Smug."

A [[Blue Archive]] character, her real name is currently unknown. First mentioned by [[Iroha (blue archive)|]] near the end of "An Unconcealed Heart" event, she makes her physical appearance in "Sheside Outside" event, and returns in [spoiler]episode 8 of "Code:Box"[/spoiler]. She is responsible for releasing the Seven Prisoners just prior to the events of the game, though her motivations are currently unknown.

Her weapon is a [[flintlock]] dueling pistol.

title: one-hour_drawing_challenge
body:
The [b]Late Night Serious 60-Minute Drawing Game[/b] (深夜の真剣お絵描き60分一本勝負, Shin'ya no Shinken Oekaki 60-bu Ipponshōbu), or [b]1draw[/b] (ワンドロ, Wandoro), is a self-explanatory Twitter hashtag where artists are given a prompt and have an hour to exercise their skills.

The prompt is usually composed of three characters from a set copyright. Each copyright gets their own tag.

The challenge was originally started on May 13, 2013, by twitter user [[monyomoke]], establishing a prompt where participants were to draw [[Touhou]] characters [[komeiji_koishi|Koishi]], [[Nazrin]], and/or [[ibaraki_Kasen|Kasen]]. After a couple months, however, the organizer decided to quit, since he was tired. The role of organizer has since been passed over a couple of times.

The Touhou prompt is currently being hosted by "@1draw_night":[https://twitter.com/1draw_night]. They also have "a website":[http://1draw.aqn.jp] which hosts the artworks posted at the hashtag, with the artists' permission.

Other accounts dealing with different copyrights have been appearing. Some tags may be defunct.

h4. External links

* "Nameless Rumia's Wiki: 1draw":[https://namelessrumia.heliohost.org/w/doku.php?id=1draw]

title: sprain

Use this tag only if the character is clearly identified as having a sprain. (e.g. cool the sprained ankle)

title: hc_helicopter_(armored_core_vi)
body:
[b]AH12: HC HELICOPTER[/b]

A giant mass-produced [[helicopter]] that appears in [[armored_core_vi:_fires_of_rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

It is notorious for its difficulty as a mandatory tutorial boss, similar to [[Father Gascoigne]] in [[Bloodborne]] and [[Iudex Gundyr]] in [[Dark Souls III]].

Nicknamed ルビコプター (Rubicopter) from Japanese community, which is a portmanteau of 'Rubicon' and 'helicopter', as it is the first boss you see in Rubicon 3, and/or it belongs to Rubicon 3's Planetary Closure Administration force.
other_names: 惑星封鎖機構大型武装ヘリ

title: tokoyami_towa_(jersey_maid)
body:
The 8th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokoyami Towa]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/tokoyamitowa/status/1935653735860232521] [tn]Presumably also designed by rurudo? Update if you know for sure.[/tn]

It is a [[jersey maid]] costume, combining a [[maid]] uniform and P.E. clothes.

In this costume, she wears a [[track jacket]] with black-[[striped sleeves|striped]] [[purple sleeves]], [[frilled armband]]s, and a black center with a [[floral print]], [[maid apron]], [[striped skirt|striped]] [[black skirt]], and [[striped shorts|striped]] [[black shorts]], with the apron being worn over the skirt, and the [[shorts under skirt|shorts being worn under the skirt]], [[purple belt]] with a [[waist tassel|tassel]] looped onto it, thick white [[leg warmers]], and horned [[purple shoes|purple]] [[sneakers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she has her hair done up in [[double bun]]s with [[twin braids]] held together with [[ringlets]], a small [[green bow|green]] [[hair bows]]. She also wears a [[white headdress|white]] [[maid headdress]], she also has [[scissors hair ornament|scissor]] [[heart hair ornament|heart]], and [[diamond hair ornament]] (some are pixelated, and some not).

Her jewelry includes [[multiple rings]], a [[heart pendant]] on her jacket's zipper tab, and a single [[heart earrings|heart earring]] in addition to her usual assorted [[multiple earrings]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #27727937: Profile

title: lavi
body: Also known as Bookman Junior or Bookman Jr., Lavi is one of the main characters of [[D.Gray-Man]]. He is the apprentice of [[Bookman]] and it's said that he will succeed him eventually. He is a close friend of other protagonists [[Allen Walker]], [[Lenalee Lee]] and [[Kanda Yuu]]. He has short orange/red hair, green eyes, wears an eyepatch over his right eye, wears a headband, hoop earrings, and a scarf. Along with the [[Black Order Uniform]]. It's implied that he has a special reason for hiding his right eye under an eyepatch. His Innocence is an Equipment type in the form of a hammer called the "Iron Hammer" or as he like to call it, "Big Hammer Little Hammer". He can enlarge the size of the hammer at will and use it to crush his opponents during fights

title: cloud
body:
A cloud is a mass of water vapor that floats in the [[sky]].

h4. See also

* [[cloud focus]]
* [[cloudy sky]], a sky mostly filled with clouds
* [[overcast]], a sky completely covered with clouds
* [[dark cloud]]
* [[above clouds]]
* [[shaped cloud]], a cloud that takes the shape of something, usually an animal or object
* [[cumulonimbus cloud]], a dense, towering vertical cloud
* [[fallstreak hole]], a large gap in cirrocumulus or altocumulus clouds
* [[egasumi]], a traditional Japanese pattern of stylized clouds
* [[xiangyun]], a traditional manner of stylizing clouds with swirls

title: kemonomimi_mode
body:
When characters who don't normally have any animal-like features (such as ears or a tail) are depicted with animal ears, tail, and/or a [i]little[/i] fur.

This can also include characters who are canonically animal-like, but are depicted with a different set of animal features (post #640641, for example).

Note, however, that this does [b]not[/b] include characters who can modally become animal-like, such as [[Inu Sakuya (nejikirio)|]] or the [[Strike Witches]].

Also not to be confused with [[fake animal ears]].

When there are more animal-like features like a [[snout]] or full fur use [[furrification]] instead.

The antonym of this tag is [[no animal ears]].

h4. See also

* [[Animal ears]]
* [[Tail]]
* [[Animalization]]
* [[Character doll]]
* [[Foodification]]
* [[Furrification]]
* [[Humanization]]
* [i]Kemonomimi mode[/i]
* [[Mechanization]]
* [[Monsterification]]
* [[Objectification]]
* [[Personification]]
* [[Slimification]]
* [[Vehicalization]]
* [[Zombification]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: foreclosure_task_force_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], the Foreclosure Task Force (Also known as Countermeasures Committee in Japanese) is the only current club of Abydos High School. Its members jointly formed it to raise money and prevent their school's closure due to its debts.

[spoiler] the head leader is Hoshino, but in its earliest aspects was Yume. Shiroko Terror also joined the committee and made the said group into a Council. [/spoiler]

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

* [[Ayane (blue archive)|]]
* [spoiler][[Shiroko Terror (blue archive)|]][/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Yume (blue archive)|]] (Dead)[/spoiler]
other_names: アビドス廃校対策委員会

title: calico_cat
body:
([i]Mike-neko[/i], Tricolor cat)

Describes a [[cat]] with patches of white, orange and black fur. For the pattern itself, which can be applied to anything else with this coloration, see [[calico (pattern)]].

A variation of the [[tortoiseshell cat]], though that tag is reserved for cats with the more traditional brindled pattern.

The vast majority of tortoiseshell and calico cats are female due to the genetic basis of cat coloration. Males are infertile due to an intersex condition, typically being XXY.

h4. Related tags

* [[Caliby cat]]
* [[Dilute tortoiseshell]]
* [[Tortoiseshell cat]]
** [[Torbie cat]]
** [[Tortico cat]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calico_cat]

title: tortoiseshell_cat
body:
A very unique multicolored fur pattern for domestic [[cat]]s, it combines black fur with orange/yellow fur mixed very closely, creating a color pattern similar to a tortoise's shell.

The vast majority of tortoiseshell and calico cats are female due to the genetic basis of cat coloration. Males are infertile due to an intersex condition, typically being XXY.

Some torties have a 'split-face' pattern as depicted in post #6879810. This is sometimes incorrectly attributed to genetic chimerism.

h4. See also

* [[Calico cat]] (also known as [i]tortoiseshell-and-white[/i])
** [[Caliby cat]]
* [[Dilute tortoiseshell]]
* [[Torbie cat]]
* [[Tortico cat]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tortoiseshell cat":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tortoiseshell_cat]

title: off-shoulder_shirt
body:
A [[shirt]] that is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline, not covering [b]both[/b] shoulders or the upper chest area, leaving them [[bare shoulders|bare]]. The sleeves [i]must be attached[/i] to the shirt.

Off-shoulder shirts are meant to emphasize and accentuate the wearer's shoulders, [[collarbone]], and neck (or [[nape]]), with the sleeves of an off-shoulder shirt sitting on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.

h4.Correct examples

* !post #2098240
* !post #6542739
* !post #3914611
* !post #6758407
* !post #7114436

h4.Incorrect examples

* !post #4576682: [[open shirt|Open]] or partially-open shirts that are simply worn [[off shoulder|hanging off]] the arms.
* !post #9202450: [[Koharu (Blue Archive)|]]'s shirt (design of her shirt makes it obvious she can wear it without exposing her shoulders, as shown in post #9476692)
* !post #7205989: [[Shoulder cutout]]s

body:

title: maine_coon
body:
A large breed of longhaired [[cat]] distinguishable by their tufted ears and neck fluff. They often exhibit the "smoke" gene, which causes a lighter underside to their fur.

Together with the [[Norwegian Forest Cat]] and [[Siberian Forest Cat]], it forms the "forest cat" breed group.

They are notable for their large size and rosetted spot pattern.

body:
[b]Businessman[/b], [b]OL[/b] (Japanese) [b]Office Worker[/b], [b]Clerk[/b] (English)

A trainer class that debuted in [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] [[Pokemon BW|Black and White]].

The female variety is one of the trainers classes [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]] and [[Nate (pokemon)|]] can ride Nimbasa City's [[ferris wheel]] with during the in-game months of autumn (March, July, November). In [[pokemon bw2|Black 2 and White 2]], [[Rosa (pokemon)|]] can also ride with a male clerk during the summer months (February, June, October).

title: shangri-la_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Essex[/i]-class carrier USS [i]Shangri-La[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Fujita Akane (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]] with [[glasses]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of the typical [i]Essex[/i]-class garb: [[blue cloak]] with a five-pointed star representing the Eagle Union faction, [[blue dress]] with [[cleavage cutout]], and a [[red necktie]]. She also wears [[snowflake hair ornament]]s, [[grey socks]], and black [[boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is also shared with the rest of the class: a split [[flight deck]] arrangement. Instead of her hull number, she has the letter "Z" painted forward "as it was when Japan surrendered":[https://www.navsource.org/archives/02/023805.jpg] to signify occupation duties.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3456116: Default
* !post #3456114: [[Shangri-La (Utopia's Collector) (Azur Lane)|Utopia's Collector]] 
* !post #3973199: [[Shangri-La (Explorer Of The Lost World) (Azur Lane)|Explorer of the Lost World]]

title: zarude
body:
A Dark/Grass-type Mythical [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0893 in the National Pokédex.

Somewhat resembles a [[baboon]]. Has [[black fur]], [[green eyes]], [[red sclera]]e, and [[sharp teeth]], including a pair of [[fangs]].

A specific Zarude known as "[[zarude (dada)|Dada]]" plays a major role in [[pokemon the movie: secrets of the jungle|Pokémon the Movie: Secrets of the Jungle]]. It is the adoptive father of [[Koko (pokemon)|]], and can be distinguished from other Zarude by the [[torn scarf|torn]] [[purple scarf]] it wears.

Japanese name: [b]Zarude[/b]

title: busujima_saeko
body:
The main female character of [[Highschool of the Dead]]. She uses a [[bokken]] and later a [[katana]] called the Murata-tou in her fight against zombies.

Her [[breasts]] can bounce faster than the speed of sound. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[blue eyes]] alongside [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of the [[fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with green accents alongside a [[black bowtie]] and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]]. Originally, she wore a [[long skirt]] although she is seen later on wearing a shorter skirt with [[black thighhighs]] and [[garter straps]].

Her tendency not to wear much causes her bust to get emphasized in the anime and exaggerated in fanart. Due to wearing an [[apron]] and [[thong]] she also is famous for her sizable [[ass]], occasionally reaching [[huge ass]] sizes ([tn]See post #801899.[/tn]).

title: ar-10
body:
The [b]AR-10[/b] is an [[united states|American]]-designed 7.62×51mm NATO [[battle rifle]], developed in 1955 by Eugene Stoner at ArmaLite. It was relatively lightweight due to its heavy use of aluminum and fiberglass furniture, yet also one of the most controllable in fully automatic fire due to its straight-line stock design. It was rejected by the [[united states army|U.S. Army]] in favor of the [[M14]] and was used only by a handful of foreign [[military|militaries]]. 

This tag is most often used for AR-pattern rifles chambered in the above cartridge that use SR-25 pattern magazines.

* !post #6193600: Early AR-10 models with Bakelite handguard.
h4. See also
* [[AR-15]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[SR-25]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: ArmaLite AR-10":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ArmaLite_AR-10

title: takagi_saya
body:
Supporting character from [[Highschool of the Dead]]. Uses a [[drill]] for fending off the zombie hordes at school before upgrading to a long-barreled [[Luger P08]] equipped with a stock and a 32-round [[drum magazine]] that was given to her by her mother, [[Takagi Yuriko]].

She is the daughter of a prominent politician and the smartest among the group, making her the brains although arrogant and brash. She is also a childhood friend of [[Komuro Takashi]].

She has [[pink hair|pink]] [[long hair]] usually tied in a [[twintails]] and [[yellow eyes]] along with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of the [[fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with green accents alongside a [[black bowtie]] and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]].

h4.Family
* [[Takagi Souichiro]] (father)
* [[Takagi Yuriko]] (mother)

title: hirano_kouta_(hsotd)
body:
A supporting character from [[Highschool of The Dead]]. He is the nerdy yet avid [[gun]] enthusiast of the group, first armed with a modified [[nail gun]] before upgrading to a scoped ArmaLite [[AR-10]] rifle modified to resemble a KAC [[SR-25]].

He is a [[fat man|chubby male]] with [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]] and wears [[glasses]]. His outfit is a [[Fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[gakuran]] and [[black pants]].

His name (and some features) is based on mangaka [[Hirano Kouta]].

title: miyamoto_rei
body:
One of the main female characters from [[Highschool of the Dead]]. She is initially armed with a mop handle before using a police [[baton (weapon)|baton]] and later a customized [[M14]] rifle fitted with a [[bayonet]].

She is both a childhood friend and the main love interest of [[Komuro Takashi]].

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] and [[orange eyes]] with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of the [[fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with green accents alongside a [[black bowtie]] and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]].

title: komuro_takashi
body:
Main protagonist of [[Highschool of the Dead]]. His weapon of choice is his [[baseball bat]] and a [[Smith & Wesson]] [[snubnosed revolver]] that he takes from a dead cop, and later an [[Ithaca M37]] that he also swaps for a [[Benelli M4]] combat shotgun during the events of the manga.

He is a second year student from Fujimi Academy and the love interest for [[Miyamoto Rei]].

He is a tall young man with [[black hair|black]] [[spiked hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. His outfit is a [[Fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[gakuran]] and [[black pants]].

title: convention
body:
An event where people share their love for some subject (Ex: animecon).

A popular event at anime conventions is the selling of [[manga (object)|doujins]] by various authors at the author’s respective tables, so if the image shows a table with doujins stacked on it, the author sitting on one side, and people lining up to buy them from the other side, the setting of the image is probably a convention.

title: wombforce
body:
A [[meme]] originating from the [[Girls' Frontline]] community. Due to the robots of its world, otherwise known as Dolls, being modular in nature (with the playable T-Dolls featuring upgraded civilian-grade A-Dolls), players began joking about artificial womb modules that would not only allow the robots to have [[sex]], but to get [[pregnant]] as well. Epitomized by post #2993427, giving the module its name, the [b]Wombforce[/b], a parody of NVidia's GeForce graphic cards. When asked about whether Dolls could give birth, the official Twitter did "not refute":[https://twitter.com/GirlsFrontlineE/status/1070203475194073088] the potential of such a module existing, spurring further jokes.

The meme has since spread outside of Girls' Frontline, with references to Wombforce being found in fan works of other franchises featuring gynoids.

h4. See also

* [[mechanical pussy]]

title: peeta_mellark
body:

He has [[blonde hair]] and is commonly depicted as being [[muscular male|muscular]]. He is an avid baker and artist, often being associated with [[bread]].

He is depicted in the films by [[Josh Hutcherson]].

title: pixel_art
body:
An image drawn with a pixelated art style, typically with large individual pixels and a limited color palette.

This may be either intentional or as a restriction by the software used to create it. This is common in older GIF images as well as images meant to invoke game [[sprite]]s.

Different from [[oekaki]], which has less emphasis on being drawn with individual pixels.

h4. Examples

* !post #7565051: With [[dithering]]
* !post #7606805: [[Isometric]]
* !post #7533961: [[No lineart]]
* !post #3790553: [[Sprite art]]
* !post #4528014: [[LEGO (medium)|]] pixel art

h4. Non-examples

* !post #7455465: [[Official art inset]] with pixel artwork
* !post #7550349: [[Pixel art inset]]
* !post #5309196: [[Oekaki]]

h4.  See also

* [[oekaki]]
* [[pixelated]]
* [[sprite art]]

title: realistic
body:
Art with a more realistic approach to its anatomy, proportion, lighting and so on.

Use [[photorealistic]] for posts so realistic they could be mistaken for photographs.

title: old_man
body:

See [[aged up]] for when a male character is drawn older than his normal age.

Use with [[mature male]] if drawn attractively.

h4. See also

* [[ugly bastard]]

title: mature_male
body:
An attractive "middle-aged" or older man. Usually (but not necessarily) having varying amounts of [[facial hair]] and/or [[body hair]]. Alternate terms, depending on age range, can include DILF ([b]D[/b]ad [b]I[/b]'d [b]L[/b]ike to [b]F[/b]uck; used regardless of the fact whether he's had children or not), rhino or manther.

Use with [[old man]] if drawn attractively. [[Soriz]] from [[Granblue Fantasy]] is a good example.

title: yubitsume
body:
Yubitsume (指詰め; 'finger shortening') is a Japanese ritual to atone for offenses to another, a way to be punished or to show sincere apology and remorse to another, by means of amputating portions of one's own little finger primarily performed by the [[yakuza]]. These days, however, it is not as widely practiced anymore and replaced with simply giving the offended party loads of cash.

To perform yubitsume, one lays down a small clean cloth and lays the hand onto the cloth facing down. Using an extremely sharp [[knife]], or [[tantou]], the person cuts off the portion of their left little finger above the top knuckle on the finger or the tip of the finger. They then wrap the severed portion in the cloth and submit the "package" very graciously to their superior – or to whomever this gesture of atonement is made.

If more offenses are committed, then the person moves on to the next joint of the finger to perform yubitsume. More infractions could mean removing portions of the right little finger when no more joints of the left finger remain. In some cases, a person expelled from a yakuza gang might be required to perform the yubitsume ritual.

title: green_april_(weapon)
body:
[[Green April (weapon)]] (초록 사월, 草綠 四月, Chorok Sawol; "Green Fourth Moon") is one of the 13 Month Series made by the blacksmith or crafts master, Ashul Edwaru. The weapon is sentient and has a girl spirit inside it. It was first owned by [[Anak Zahard]]'s mother who was a Princess, then by [[Anak zahard]] herself. The weapon is currently in the possession of [[Ha Yuri Zahard]].

It is a [[hook]] capable of elongating and as it's also a Compression Weapon; Ignition will decompress part or all of it. When Ignited, the Green April could turn a place into "a massive forest". The Green April is a 7B-rank Hook, which most likely becomes A-Rank when Ignited.

title: black_march_(weapon)
body:
[[Black march (Tower Of God)]] (검은 삼월, 검은 三月, Geomeun Sahmwol; "Black Third Moon") is one of the 13 Month Series made by the blacksmith or crafts master, Ashul Edwaru. The weapon is sentient and has a girl spirit inside it and when ignited, it is capable of unleashing extreme power like the other 13 Month Series.

As a weapon, it is a jet black needle that is extremely thin with a slightly thicker handle. On the handle "Black March" is embroidered in cursive.

title: green_april_(tower_of_god)
body:
[[Green April (Tower Of God)]] (초록 사월, 草綠 四月, Chorok Sawol; "Green Fourth Moon") is one of the 13 Month Series made by the blacksmith or crafts master, Ashul Edwaru. The weapon is sentient and has a girl spirit inside it. It was first owned by [[Anak Zahard]]'s mother who was a Princess, then by [[Anak Zahard]] herself. The weapon is currently in the possession of Ha [[Ha Yuri Zahard]].

In its true humanoid form, Green April assumes the appearance of a young lady who has [[pale skin]] and  dark green [[very short hair]] dressed in a sleeveless and strapless green dress. She has two slightly longer pieces of hair on either side of her face, as well as having bangs. She also has [[green eyes]] , as well as elf-like ears.

title: black_march_(tower_of_god)
body:
[[Black March (Tower Of God)]] (검은 삼월, 검은 三月, Geomeun Sahmwol; "Black Third Moon") is one of the 13 Month Series made by the blacksmith or crafts master, Ashul Edwaru. The weapon is sentient and has a girl spirit inside it and when ignited, it is capable of unleashing extreme power like the other 13 Month Series.

When Ignited, [[Black March (Tower Of God)]] comes to life. It assumes the appearance of a young lady with golden hair and pointed ears dressed in an elaborate red gown. It has the ability to communicate with its user and others who have used it before. The needle is sexist as it prefers handsome males over other categories; It refuse to listen to neither [[Ha Yuri Zahard]]  and also [[Anak Zahard]] whom are both female users, but instead it works just fine for [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]] because his face is just her "type". It also rejected [[Ship Leesoo]] , probably because he is not handsome. Like [[Green April (Tower Of God)]] , it considers [[Ha Yuri Zahard]] to be somewhat of an idiot.

title: platinum_(arknights)
body:
[i]Platinum, member of Kazimierz Armorless Union, will provide versatile fire support on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazimierz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]February 13[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Kuranta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]160 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]6 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Platinum was previously an assassin for the Kazimierz Armorless Union. She has demonstrated considerable talent and special tactical accomplishments in high-mobility operations, clearance, and urban warfare.

Her real name is revealed to be Centaurea during the Near Light event. She was an idol knight, staging fights in the arena for companies in Kazimierz before becoming an Armorless Union assassin.

Her motif is based on the [[Pegasus]].

She is voiced by [[Kitajima Mizuki]], who replaced [[Kayano Ai]] due to controversial reasons.

h4. Skins

* [[Platinum (Shimmering Dew) (arknights)|Shimmering Dew]]

title: kujo_jolyne
body:
The main protagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6, [[Stone Ocean]]. Her [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Stone Free]]. Daughter of Part 3 protagonist [[Kujo Jotaro]]. Her name is sometimes officially romanized as "Jolyne Cujoh".

She wears her [[two-tone hair]] in [[double bun]]s, usually with a [[braided ponytail]] in back. Her usual attire is a [[halterneck]] that exposes her [[midriff]] and pants that are attached to her boots. On her top is a large heart [[brooch]] with a drawing of a knife and a butterfly on it. She has a [[tattoo]] with the same design as her brooch on her left forearm, a single wristband on her right forearm, and a star [[navel piercing]]. The way she is drawn by [[Araki Hirohiko]] makes it ambiguous as to whether she wears panties or not.

Her outfit is very [[y2k fashion|Y2K]]-esque with the butterfly and heart motifs and shape of the clothing.

body:
The title and main character of [[Kunoichi Tsubaki no Mune no Uchi]]. She is a [[ninja|kunoichi]] and the leader of Dog Squad with [[Asagao (kunoichi tsubaki no mune no uchi)|]], [[Sazanka (kunoichi tsubaki no mune no uchi)|]], and later [spoilers][[Rindou (kunoichi tsubaki no mune no uchi)|]][/spoilers]. She has a strange feeling in her heart whenever the boys is brought up.


She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] stylized in a [[high ponytail]] with [[bangs]]. She wears a [[red scarf]], a [[crop top]] with [[short sleeves]] showing her [[midriff]], [[black shorts]], [[green gloves|green]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[sandals]].

title: namor
body:
Character from [[Marvel]], although originally created in the Timely Comics era by Bill Everett.
Namor, known as the Submariner, is a half-human, half-Atlantean prince of Atlantis, who fought in World War II alongside [[Captain America]] and the original Human Torch.
He has worked for several other superhero teams, but his hatred for humanity for polluting the oceans has also lead him to clash with other heroes.

title: leviathan_(wuthering_waves)
body:
Non-playable character in [[Wuthering Waves]].

The Threnodian of Rinascita, having corrupted its Sentinel [[Imperator (Wuthering Waves)|]]. It has created many vessels to execute its will and bring about the complete destruction of the city, namely: [[Mya (Wuthering Waves)|]], [[Lupa (Wuthering Waves)|]] and [[Fleurdelys (Wuthering Waves)|]], with an additional failed attempt to take over [[Cantarella (Wuthering Waves)|]].

title: lord_of_the_mysteries
body:
A Chinese trilogy web-novel story written by Cuttlefish That Loves Diving. First part is composed of 8 volumes. Second book, [[Circle of Inevitability]], was officially released on 4th of March.  The "web comic adaption":https://www.webnovel.com/comic/lord-of-the-mysteries_15896372906358001 was translated but cancelled later on. 

There was an "anime announcement":[https://www.weibo.com/6340649546/KstWn6j5z?pagetype=profilefeed] and the "release date trailer":[https://www.weibo.com/6340649546/NdCONkPPR?pagetype=profilefeed] confirm it for 2025. On the 28th of June  "the anime was released":[https://weibo.com/7344384861/PyB7dnlMO].

There is a "game announcement":[https://weibo.com/7344384861/MriAo7WQy] by the name of "Code Name Mystery":[https://lotm.tzxxx.com/?mark_id=999_reallog_mark_ad%3A999%7CWeiboADNatural&continueFlag=8f75ea3c60f02d7aee7fc531bc0ee944] that includes pre-registration for interested people.

h4. Synopsis

In the waves of steam and machinery, who could achieve extraordinary? In the fogs of history and darkness, who was whispering? I woke up from the realm of mysteries and opened my eyes to the world.

Firearms, cannons, battleships, airships, and difference machines. Potions, divination, curses, hanged-man, and sealed artifacts… The lights shone brightly, yet the secrets of the world were never far away. This was a legend of the “fool”.

She is a [[ringmaster]] of a circus outside of Pallet Town, her main [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokemon]] being [[Mr. Mime]].



She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], wears typical attire of a ringmaster consisting of: A [[red jacket|red]] [[open jacket|open]] [[tailcoat]] with [[gold sleeve cuffs]], [[white pants]], [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]], and a pair of pink [[sphere earrings]].

body:
The first of a gauntlet of true final bosses in [i][[The Binding of Isaac]]: Repentance[/i]. It spawns from the television at Home as a creature of pure TV static.
With this fact and the "lyrics" of its boss music, it represents the Christian broadcasts [[isaac_(the_binding_of_isaac)|Isaac's]]  mom has been watching, as well as certain interpretations of [[the Bible]].

title: hyuuga_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
In her kai ni form, [i]Hyuuga[/i] discards the heavy [[rigging]] of her base/kai forms and opts for a simpler style: two 410 mm mounts (one twin and one triple) to her left and her [[flight deck]] and [[quiver]] on her right. Her clothing choice ([[white kimono]], [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black socks|black kneehighs]], white [[hachimaki]]) are now easily visible. However, one noticeable difference from these plans is the presence of helicopter landing markings on her flight deck, which is reflective of her [[JS Hyuuga|JMSDF DDH namesake]].

[[Hyuuga (kancolle)|]] is most notable for being an "Aviation Battleship" after problems with her fifth turret (which detonated during gunnery practice), and the sinking of most major fleet carriers made the IJN desperate for more carrier capacity. Historically, this never panned out well, as the IJN was out of pilots and planes to launch by the time Hyuuga and Ise were ready. Her Kai Ni partially reflects a "2/3 conversion" plan that would have retained only the two forward main gun mounts and convert the rest into a carrier. This was historically ruled out as well, since the capacity would be too big for the launching facility (2 catapults) to keep up, causing delays when launching attack squadrons.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3458629

h4. See also

* [[Ise Kai Ni (kancolle)|]]

title: ise_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Ise[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied with a red [[hair ribbon]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] comprising a pale [[white kimono]] top, [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[brown hakama]] tied around the waist with a [[sash]], [[brown socks]], and [[sandals]]. She always wears a [[katana]] at her side. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and bridge to her back, five (or four at kai form) 35.6 cm twin gun mounts, and a [[radar]] and [[flight deck]] replacing one of her gun turrets at kai form. 

The Ise-class are the poster girls of KanColle Arcade, SEGA's card-based arcade adaptation of the browser game.

title: gilgamesh_(caster)_(fate)
body:
[[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] as he appears as a Caster-class character in the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i].

This version of Gil is taken from the end of his namesake epic, after a lengthy and ultimately fruitless journey in search of immortality. As a result, he is a much wiser man, and the much beloved king of Uruk, though he still keeps some of his trademark arrogance and he's fighting a war on three fronts by the time the player character comes in. He is also established to be a workaholic by this time.

Can be distinguished from his normal counterpart by the [[jewelry]] on top of his [[double-parted bangs]] and his [[tattoo]]s.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ginka Sima]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Seki Tomokazu]]

title: battle_in_new_york_2018
body:
[b]Battle in New York 2018[/b]
[quote]With incredible rewards and the title of strongest Servant at stake, the fall festival for Chaldea's courageous warriors returns once again! As Nero, brimming with enthusiasm, makes her way to the Colosseum, the cheers of delighted crowds of Roman citizens shall greet her!

...Or not. What she finds instead is treasure stolen from her own vaults by persons unknown, and the voice of the King of Heroes echoing across the land.

"I shall determine who the strongest Servant is!"

The glorious brawl, Battle in New York 2018, begins now, hosted this time by none other than Gilgamesh![/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on September 19, 2018 and on the NA server on September 14, 2020.

h4. Characters

title: honey_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Honey[/b] (English), [b]Mitsuba[/b] (Japanese)

A character introduced in [i][[Pokemon SwSh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i]'s [i]The Isle of Armor[/i] DLC. Honey is [[Mustard (pokemon)|]]'s wife, [[Hyde (pokemon)|]]'s mother, the Dojo Matron, and the creator of [[Max Soup]].

She wears apparel similar to that of Sword and Shield's [[Beauty_(pokemon)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]] with [[aqua eyeshadow]] and [[purple nails]]. She wears a [[green sweater]] with [[hip vent|hip vents]] and [[shoulder cutout|shoulder cutouts]], a [[gold bracelet]], [[leaf earrings]], and [[white pants]].

title: kingu_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. A god from Babylonian mythology.

He uses [[Enkidu (fate)|]]'s body throughout the Babylonia Singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], but his personality is markedly different from the original Enkidu's. The only visual difference between Kingu and the regular Enkidu is Kingu's [[purple eyes]], as opposed to Enkidu's [[green eyes]]. And despite retaining the same [[androgynous]] appearance and [[1other|body]] as Enkidu, Kingu considers himself male and is referred to as such by himself and others.

title: flash_gordon_(series)
body:
[b]Flash Gordon[/b] is the name of a classic (and very influential) [[science fiction]] franchise that started as a space opera adventure comic strip originally drawn by American cartoonist "Alex Raymond":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_Raymond . First published in January 7, 1934, the strip was inspired by and created to compete with the already established [[Buck Rogers]] adventure strip.

The comic strip follows the adventures of [[Flash Gordon]] and his companions [[Dale Arden]] and [[Dr. Hans Zarkov]] in an alien planet called Mongo and their fight against [[Ming the Merciless]], Mongo's evil ruler.

The Flash Gordon comic series has been translated into a wide variety of media, including motion pictures, television and animated series in several different countries across the world and during many decades. 

Flash Gordon was featured in three vintage serial films starring American actor Buster Crabbe: "Flash Gordon" (1936), "Flash Gordon's Trip to Mars" (1938), and "Flash Gordon Conquers the Universe" (1940). The first Flash Gordon serial remains copyrighted, but the compilation made of the second serial, and the third serial itself are in the public domain.

In 1980 a "campy styled" Flash Gordon film was produced to critical acclaim. It stars former Playgirl-centerfold Sam J. Jones in the title role. Its plot is based loosely on the first few years of the comic strip (in particular the famous Alex Raymond Sunday page, "Flight of the Hawkmen") revising Flash's backstory by making him the quarterback of the New York Jets instead of a polo player. 

Raymond's drawings feature heavily in the opening credits of the 1980 film, as does the signature theme-song [b]"Flash!"[/b] by rock band [[queen_(band)|Queen]], who composed and performed the entire musical score.

The latest version, a Flash Gordon television series, appeared on the United States Syfy in 2007–2008.

h4. See also
* [[Star Wars]] - A very popular sci-fi series heavily influenced by Flash Gordon
other_names: フラッシュ・ゴードン

title: help:tag_implications
body:
Tag implications are used when all images belonging to one tag should also be tagged with another, broader tag. For example, [[4koma]] implies [[comic]], and [[fate/stay_night]] implies [[fate_(series)]]. 

Since implications are applied automatically with no way to override them, they are not used in situations where one tag is only commonly, but not always, tagged with another. Special care should be taken to consider potential edge cases when requesting the creation of an implication.

Implications are only used when both tags are of the same type (general, copyright, character, or artist). Character tags do not imply their respective copyrights, as the maintenance burden for such a system would be too high and of questionable benefit (see topic #10624).

When two tags refer to exactly the same concept, an [[help:tag_aliases|alias]] should be created instead.

You can request that an implication be created using the "bulk update request form":/bulk_update_requests/new.

title: help:tag_aliases
body:
Tag aliases are used to fix a "canonical" version of a tag's name. This feature is used in a few different scenarios:

* Variant spellings, especially for character names: [[kyuubey]] → [[kyubey]].
* Synonyms: [[clavicle]] → [[collarbone]].
* Translating names of copyrights: [[The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya]] → [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]]
* Artists that have changed their preferred names.

When the antecedent tag (before the arrow) is added to an image, Danbooru automatically replaces it with consequent tag (after the arrow). The antecedent is otherwise treated as being identical to the consequent for searches and some other actions.

Tag aliases differ from [[help:tag_implications|implications]]. In a tag implication, rather than redirecting tags, one tag automatically adds the other. In other words, aliases are for tags referring to the same thing, while implications are for situations where one tag describes a subset of the images belonging to another tag.

You can request that an alias be created by using the "bulk update request form":/bulk_update_requests/new.

h4. Chained aliases

h6. Given that A -> B alias exists

* If B -> C gets added
* Then the alias is updated to A -> C

h6. Given that B -> C alias exists

* A -> B aliases are rejected
